  8318                                  ;************************************************************************
  8319                                  ;*									*
  8320                                  ;*	some equates for rom bios printer i/o				*
  8321                                  ;*									*
  8322                                  ;************************************************************************
  8323                                  
  8324                                  ; ibm rom status bits (i don't trust them, neither should you)
  8325                                  ; warning!!! the ibm rom does not return just one bit. it returns a
  8326                                  ; whole slew of bits, only one of which is correct.
  8327                                  
  8328                                  ;notbusystatus	equ 10000000b		; not busy
  8329                                  ;nopaperstatus	equ 00100000b		; no more paper
  8330                                  ;prnselected	equ 00010000b		; printer selected
  8331                                  ;ioerrstatus	equ 00001000b		; some kinda error
  8332                                  ;timeoutstatus	equ 00000001b		; time out.
  8333                                  ;
  8334                                  ;noprinter	equ 00110000b		; no printer attached
  8335                                  
  8336                                  ; 18/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8337                                  ;error_I24_out_of_paper	equ 9 ; MSDOS 6.0, ERR.INC, 1991
  8338                                  
  8339                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8340                                  
  8341                                  ;************************************************************************
  8342                                  ;*									*
  8343                                  ;*	prn_input - return with no error but zero chars read		*
  8344                                  ;*									*
  8345                                  ;*	enter with cx = number of characters requested			*
  8346                                  ;*									*
  8347                                  ;************************************************************************
  8348                                  
  8349                                  prn_input:				; 2C7h:21Ah = 70h:278Ah
  8350 00000218 E8BCFE                  		call	bc_err_cnt	; reset	count to zero
  8351                                  					; (sub reqpkt.count,cx)
  8352                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8353                                  prn_done:
  8354 0000021B F8                      		clc			; but return with carry	reset for no error
  8355 0000021C C3                      		retn
  8356                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8357                                  
  8358                                  ;************************************************************************
  8359                                  ;*									*
  8360                                  ;*	prn_writ - write cx bytes from es:di to printer device		*
  8361                                  ;*									*
  8362                                  ;*	auxnum has printer number					*
  8363                                  ;*									*
  8364                                  ;************************************************************************
  8365                                  
  8366                                  prn_writ:				; 2C7h:21Fh = 70h:278Fh
  8367                                  		;jcxz	short prn_done	; no chars to output
  8368 0000021D E3FC                    		jcxz	prn_done	; 19/10/2022
  8369                                  prn_loop:				
  8370 0000021F BB0200                  		mov	bx, 2		; retry	count
  8371                                  prn_out:				
  8372 00000222 E83600                  		call	prnstat		; get status
  8373 00000225 751D                    		jnz	short TestPrnError
  8374 00000227 268A05                  		mov	al, [es:di]	; get character	to print
  8375 0000022A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  8376 0000022C E82E00                  		call	prnop		; print	to printer
  8377 0000022F 7419                    		jz	short prn_con	; no error - continue
  8378 00000231 80FCFF                  		cmp	ah, 0FFh	; MODE_CTRLBRK
  8379 00000234 7509                    		jnz	short _prnwf
  8380 00000236 B00C                    		mov	al, 0Ch		; error_I24_gen_failure
  8381 00000238 C606[0C00]00            		mov	byte [altah], 0
  8382 0000023D EB08                    		jmp	short pmessg
  8383                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8384                                  
  8385                                  _prnwf:					
  8386 0000023F F6C401                  		test	ah, 1		; timeoutstatus
  8387 00000242 7406                    		jz	short prn_con
  8388                                  TestPrnError:				
  8389 00000244 4B                      		dec	bx		; retry	until count is exhausted.
  8390 00000245 75DB                    		jnz	short prn_out
  8391                                  pmessg:					
  8392 00000247 E98DFE                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt
  8393                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8394                                  
  8395                                  prn_con:				
  8396 0000024A 47                      		inc	di		; point	to next	char and continue
  8397 0000024B E2D2                    		loop	prn_loop
  8398                                  ;prn_done:				
  8399                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8400                                  prn_done2:
  8401                                  		;clc
  8402                                  		; cf=0
  8403 0000024D C3                      		retn
  8404                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8405                                  
  8406                                  ;************************************************************************
  8407                                  ;*									*
  8408                                  ;*	prn_stat - device driver entry to return printer status		*
  8409                                  ;*									*
  8410                                  ;************************************************************************
  8411                                  
  8412                                  prn_stat:				; 2C7h:251h = 70h:27C1h
  8413 0000024E E80A00                  		call	prnstat		; device in dx
  8414 00000251 75F4                    		jnz	short pmessg
  8415 00000253 F6C480                  		test	ah, 80h		; notbusystatus
  8416                                  		;jnz	short prn_done
  8417                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8418 00000256 75F5                    		jnz	short prn_done2 ; cf=0
  8419 00000258 E96BFF                  		jmp	z_bus_exit
  8420                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8421                                  
  8422                                  ;************************************************************************
  8423                                  ;*									*
  8424                                  ;*	prnstat - utility function to call ROM BIOS to check		*
  8425                                  ;*		 printer status. Return meaningful error code		*
  8426                                  ;*									*
  8427                                  ;************************************************************************
  8428                                  
  8429                                  prnstat:				
  8430 0000025B B402                    		mov	ah, 2		; set command for get status
  8431                                  					; PRINTER - GET	STATUS
  8432                                  					; DX = printer port (0-3)
  8433                                  					; Return: AH = status
  8434                                  
  8435                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8436                                  
  8437                                  ;************************************************************************
  8438                                  ;*									*
  8439                                  ;*	prnop - call ROM BIOS printer function in ah			*
  8440                                  ;*		return zero true if no error				*
  8441                                  ;*		return zero false if error, al = error code		*
  8442                                  ;*									*
  8443                                  ;************************************************************************
  8444                                  
  8445                                  prnop:	
  8446 0000025D 8B16[2100]              		mov	dx, [auxnum]	; get printer number
  8447 00000261 CD17                    		int	17h
  8448                                  
  8449                                  	; This check was added to see if this is a case of no
  8450                                  	; printer being installed. This tests checks to be sure
  8451                                  	; the error is noprinter (30h)
  8452                                  
  8453 00000263 50                      		push	ax
  8454 00000264 80E430                  		and	ah, 30h
  8455 00000267 80FC30                  		cmp	ah, 30h		; noprinter
  8456 0000026A 58                      		pop	ax
  8457 0000026B 7506                    		jnz	short NextTest
  8458 0000026D 80E4DF                  		and	ah, 0DFh	; ~nopaperstatus
  8459 00000270 80CC08                  		or	ah, 8		; ioerrstatus
  8460                                  
  8461                                  ; examine the status bits to see if an error occurred. unfortunately, several
  8462                                  ; of the bits are set so we have to pick and choose. we must be extremely
  8463                                  ; careful about breaking basic.
  8464                                  
  8465                                  NextTest:				
  8466 00000273 F6C428                  		test	ah, 28h		; (ioerrstatus+nopaperstatus)
  8467                                  					; i/o error?
  8468 00000276 740A                    		jz	short checknotready ; no, try not ready
  8469                                  
  8470                                  ; at this point, we know we have an error. the converse is not true
  8471                                  
  8472 00000278 B009                    		mov	al, 9		; error_I24_out_of_paper
  8473                                  					; first, assume	out of paper
  8474 0000027A F6C420                  		test	ah, 20h		; out of paper set?
  8475 0000027D 7502                    		jnz	short ret1	; yes, error is	set
  8476 0000027F FEC0                    		inc	al		; return al=10 (i/o error)
  8477                                  ret1:					
  8478 00000281 C3                      		retn
  8479                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8480                                  
  8481                                  checknotready:				
  8482 00000282 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; assume not-ready
  8483 00000284 F6C401                  		test	ah, 1
  8484 00000287 C3                      		retn
  8485                                  
  8486                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8487                                  
  8488                                  ;************************************************************************
  8489                                  ;*									*
  8490                                  ;*	prn_tilbusy - output until busy. Used by print spooler.		*
  8491                                  ;*		     this entry point should never block waiting for	*
  8492                                  ;*		     device to come ready.				*
  8493                                  ;*									*
  8494                                  ;*	inputs:	cx = count, es:di -> buffer				*
  8495                                  ;*	outputs: set the number of bytes transferred in the		*
  8496                                  ;*		 device driver request packet				*
  8497                                  ;*									*
  8498                                  ;************************************************************************
  8499                                  
  8500                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8501                                  prn_tilbusy:				; 2C7h:28Bh = 70h:27FBh
  8502 00000288 89FE                    		mov	si, di		; everything is	set for	lodsb
  8503                                  prn_tilbloop:				
  8504 0000028A 51                      		push	cx
  8505 0000028B 53                      		push	bx
  8506 0000028C 30FF                    		xor	bh, bh
  8507 0000028E 8A1E[E704]              		mov	bl, [printdev]
  8508 00000292 D1E3                    		shl	bx, 1
  8509                                  		;mov	cx, ds:wait_count[bx] ;	wait count times to come ready
  8510 00000294 8B8F[E804]              		mov	cx, [wait_count+bx]
  8511 00000298 5B                      		pop	bx
  8512                                  prn_getstat:				
  8513 00000299 E8BFFF                  		call	prnstat		; get status
  8514 0000029C 7514                    		jnz	short prn_bperr	; error
  8515 0000029E F6C480                  		test	ah, 80h		; ready	yet?
  8516 000002A1 E1F6                    		loope	prn_getstat	; no, go for more
  8517 000002A3 59                      		pop	cx		; get original count
  8518 000002A4 740D                    		jz	short prn_berr	; still	not ready => done
  8519 000002A6 26                      		es
  8520 000002A7 AC                      		lodsb
  8521                                  		;lods	byte ptr es:[si] ; es
  8522                                  					; lodsb
  8523 000002A8 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  8524 000002AA E8B0FF                  		call	prnop
  8525 000002AD 7504                    		jnz	short prn_berr	; error
  8526 000002AF E2D9                    		loop	prn_tilbloop
  8527                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8528                                  		; cf=0 (prnop)
  8529                                  		;clc			; normal no-error return
  8530 000002B1 C3                      		retn			;   from device driver
  8531                                  
  8532                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8533                                  
  8534                                  prn_bperr:				
  8535 000002B2 59                      		pop	cx		; restore transfer count from stack
  8536                                  prn_berr:				
  8537 000002B3 E921FE                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt
  8538                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8539                                  
  8540                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8541                                  
  8542                                  ;************************************************************************
  8543                                  ;*									*
  8544                                  ;*	prn_genioctl - get/set printer retry count			*

  8547                                  
  8548                                  ; IOCTL.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  8549                                  ; 11/01/2019
  8550                                  
  8551                                  ;********************************;*
  8552                                  ; CHARACTER DEVICES (PRINTERS)	 ;*
  8553                                  ;********************************;*
  8554

  8557                                  ;;set_retry_count equ 45h

  8560                                  ;;.rc_count: resw 1

  8563                                  ;ioc_pc equ 5

  8599                                  		;clc
  8600 000002EA C3                      		retn

  8633                                  ;************************************************************************
  8634                                  ;*									*
  8635                                  ;*	aux port driver code -- "aux" == "com1"				*
  8636                                  ;*									*
  8637                                  ;*	the device driver entry/dispatch code sets up auxnum to		*
  8638                                  ;*	give the com port number to use (0=com1, 1=com2, 2=com3...)	*
  8639                                  ;*									*
  8640                                  ;************************************************************************
  8641                                  
  8642                                  ;	values in ah, requesting function of int 14h in rom bios
  8643                                  
  8644                                  ;auxfunc_send	 equ	1	;transmit
  8645                                  ;auxfunc_receive equ	2	;read
  8646                                  ;auxfunc_status	 equ	3	;request status
  8647                                  
  8648                                  ;	error flags, reported by int 14h, reported in ah:
  8649                                  
  8650                                  ;flag_data_ready equ	01h	;data ready
  8651                                  ;flag_overrun	 equ	02h	;overrun error
  8652                                  ;flag_parity	 equ	04h	;parity error
  8653                                  ;flag_frame	 equ	08h	;framing error
  8654                                  ;flag_break	 equ	10h	;break detect
  8655                                  ;flag_tranhol_emp equ	20h	;transmit holding register empty
  8656                                  ;flag_timeout	 equ	80h	;timeout
  8657                                  
  8658                                  ;	these flags reported in al:
  8659                                  
  8660                                  ;flag_cts	 equ	10h	;clear to send
  8661                                  ;flag_dsr	 equ	20h	;data set ready
  8662                                  ;flag_rec_sig	 equ	80h	;receive line signal detect
  8663

  8665                                  
  8666                                  ;************************************************************************

  8668                                  ;*	aux_read - read cx bytes from [auxnum] aux port to buffer	*
  8669                                  ;*		   at es:di						*
  8670                                  ;*									*
  8671                                  ;************************************************************************

  8673                                  aux_read:				; 2C7h:30Dh = 70h:287Dh

  8675 00000306 E311                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
  8676 00000308 E87700                  		call	getbx		; put address of auxbuf	in bx
  8677 0000030B 30C0                    		xor	al, al
  8678 0000030D 8607                    		xchg	al, [bx]
  8679 0000030F 08C0                    		or	al, al
  8680 00000311 7503                    		jnz	short aux2
  8681                                  aux1:					
  8682 00000313 E80500                  		call	auxin		; get character	from port
  8683                                  					; won't return if error
  8684                                  aux2:					
  8685 00000316 AA                      		stosb

  8689                                  auxin_retn:	; 18/12/2022

  8693                                  ;************************************************************************
  8694                                  ;*									*
  8695                                  ;*	auxin - call rom bios to read character from aux port		*
  8696                                  ;*		if error occurs, map the error and return one		*
  8697                                  ;*		level up to device driver exit code, setting		*
  8698                                  ;*		the number of bytes transferred appropriately		*

  8700                                  ;************************************************************************

  8702                                  auxin:

  8706                                  		;jnz	short arbad	; skip if any error bits set
  8707                                  		;retn

  8714 00000326 30C0                    		xor	al, al

  8716 0000032A E9AAFD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt
  8717

  8719                                  
  8720                                  ;************************************************************************
  8721                                  ;*									*

  8734 0000033E A820                    		test	al, 20h		; flag_dsr - test data set ready
  8735 00000340 7408                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8736 00000342 E8D6FF                  		call	auxin		; else aux is ready, get character
  8737 00000345 8807                    		mov	[bx], al

  8757 00000357 74F1                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)

  8760                                  		;clc

  8764                                  ;************************************************************************
  8765                                  ;*									*

  8768                                  ;*	exit:	ax = status						*
  8769                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  8770                                  ;*									*
  8771                                  ;************************************************************************
  8772                                  
  8773                                  auxstat:				
  8774 0000035A B403                    		mov	ah, 3		; auxfunc_status
  8775                                  
  8776                                  		; fall into auxop
  8777                                  
  8778                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8779                                  
  8780                                  ;************************************************************************
  8781                                  ;*									*
  8782                                  ;*	auxop - perform rom-biox aux port interrupt			*
  8783                                  ;*									*
  8784                                  ;*	entry:	ah = int 14h function number				*
  8785                                  ;*	exit:	ax = results						*
  8786                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*

  8791 0000035C 8B16[2100]              		mov	dx, [auxnum]	; ah=function code
  8792                                  					; 0=init, 1=send, 2=receive, 3=status
  8793                                  					; get port number
  8794 00000360 CD14                    		int	14h		; SERIAL I/O - GET USART STATUS
  8795                                  					; DX = port number (0-3)
  8796                                  					; Return: AX = port status code
  8797 00000362 C3                      		retn
  8798                                  
  8799                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8800                                  
  8801                                  ;************************************************************************
  8802                                  ;*									*
  8803                                  ;*	aux_flsh - flush aux input buffer - set contents of		*
  8804                                  ;*		   auxbuf [auxnum] to zero				*
  8805                                  ;*									*
  8806                                  ;*	cas - shouldn't this code call the rom bios input function	*
  8807                                  ;*	      repeatedly until it isn't ready?  to flush out any	*
  8808                                  ;*	      pending serial input queue if there's a tsr like MODE	*
  8809                                  ;*	      which is providing interrupt-buffering of aux port?	*
  8810                                  ;*									*

  8813                                  aux_flsh:				; 2C7h:36Ch = 70h:28DCh

  8817                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return

  8820 00000369 C3                      		retn

  8823                                  ;************************************************************************

  8831 0000036A E3AD                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022

  8841 0000037C E958FD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt	; call error routines

  8846                                  					; still	more character to print
  8847                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return

  8872                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8873                                  
  8874                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  8875                                  ;								:
  8876                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
  8877                                  ;								:
  8878                                  ;								:
  8879                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
  8880                                  ;								:
  8881                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
  8882                                  ;								:
  8883                                  ;	routine 		function			:
  8884                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
  8885                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
  8886                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
  8887                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
  8888                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
  8889                                  ;								:
  8890                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
  8891                                  ;								:
  8892                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
  8893                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
  8894                                  ;								:
  8895                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  8896                                  
  8897                                  ; convert time to ticks
  8898                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
  8899                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
  8900                                  
  8901                                  ;19/07/2019
  8902                                  ;09/03/2019
  8903                                  
  8904                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
  8905                                  
  8906                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
  8907                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
  8908                                  
  8909 0000038B B03C                    		mov	al, 60
  8910 0000038D F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
  8911 0000038F B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  8912 00000391 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
  8913 00000393 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
  8914 00000396 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
  8915 00000398 F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
  8916 0000039A 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
  8917 0000039C B064                    		mov	al, 100
  8918 0000039E F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
  8919 000003A0 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
  8920 000003A2 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
  8921 000003A5 B700                    		mov	bh, 0
  8922 000003A7 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
  8923 000003A9 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  8924                                  
  8925                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
  8926                                  
  8927 000003AC 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  8928 000003AD 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
  8929 000003AE BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
  8930 000003B1 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
  8931 000003B3 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
  8932 000003B5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
  8933 000003B6 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
  8934 000003B8 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
  8935 000003BA 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  8936 000003BD 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
  8937 000003BE BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
  8938 000003C1 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
  8939 000003C3 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  8940 000003C5 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  8941 000003C7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
  8942 000003C9 98                      		cbw
  8943 000003CA 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
  8944 000003CB F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
  8945 000003CD 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
  8946 000003CF CB                      		retf			; far return
  8947                                  
  8948                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8949                                  
  8950                                  ; 17/10/2022
  8951                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8952                                  
  8953                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  8954                                  ;
  8955                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
  8956                                  ;
  8957                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
  8958                                  ;
  8959                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
  8960                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
  8961                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
  8962                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
  8963                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
  8964                                  ;
  8965                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
  8966                                  ;
  8967                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  8968                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  8969                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  8970                                  ;
  8971                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  8972                                  
  8973                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
  8974 000003D0 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
  8975 000003D3 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
  8976                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
  8977 000003D4 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  8978                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  8979 000003D9 7426                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
  8980 000003DB 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
  8981                                  					; get binary hours
  8982                                  					; convert to bcd
  8983 000003DF FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  8984                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
  8985 000003E3 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
  8986 000003E5 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
  8987 000003E9 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  8988                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
  8989 000003ED 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
  8990 000003EF 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
  8991 000003F3 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  8992                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd
  8993 000003F7 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
  8994 000003F9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
  8995 000003FB FA                      		cli
  8996 000003FC B403                    		mov	ah, 3
  8997 000003FE CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  8998                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
  8999                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
  9000                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9001 00000400 FB                      		sti
  9002                                  no_cmos_1:				
  9003 00000401 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
  9004 00000405 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
  9005                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9006 00000409 FF1E[E206]              		call	far [ttticks]
  9007                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
  9008                                  					; convert time to ticks
  9009                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
  9010 0000040D FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
  9011 0000040E B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  9012 00000410 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  9013                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  9014                                  					; Return: time of day set
  9015                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
  9016 00000412 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt]
  9017 00000416 FB                      		sti
  9018                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9019 00000417 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9020 0000041C 740A                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
  9021 0000041E FF1E[0605]              		call	far [daycnttoday]
  9022                                  		;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
  9023                                  					; convert to bcd format
  9024 00000422 FA                      		cli
  9025 00000423 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
  9026 00000425 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9027                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
  9028                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  9029                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9030 00000427 FB                      		sti
  9031                                  no_cmos_2:
  9032                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9033                                  		; cf=0				
  9034                                  		;clc
  9035 00000428 C3                      		retn
  9036                                  
  9037                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9038                                  
  9039                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9040                                  
  9041                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9042                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9043                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9044                                  ;
  9045                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9046                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9047                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9048                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9049                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9050                                  ;
  9051                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9052                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9053                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9054                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9055                                  
  9056                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9057 00000429 E84E00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9058 0000042C 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9059                                  
  9060                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9061                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9062                                  ;
  9063                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9064                                  ;	       ----------------
  9065                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9066                                  ;
  9067                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9068                                  ;
  9069                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9070                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9071                                  ;		1,193,180
  9072                                  ;
  9073                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9074                                  ;
  9075                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9076                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9077                                  ;		59,659
  9078                                  ;
  9079                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9080                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9081                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9082                                  ;
  9083                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9084                                  ; multiply by 5
  9085                                  
  9086 00000430 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9087 00000432 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9088                                  					; multiply by 5
  9089 00000434 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9090 00000436 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9091 00000438 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9092 0000043A D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9093 0000043C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9094 0000043E 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9095 00000440 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9096                                  
  9097                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9098                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9099                                  
  9100 00000441 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9101 00000444 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9102                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9103 00000446 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9104 00000448 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9105 0000044A F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9106                                  
  9107                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9108                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9109                                  
  9110 0000044C 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9111 0000044E B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		;extract 1/100's
  9112                                  
  9113                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9114                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9115                                  
  9116 00000451 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9117 00000453 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9118 00000456 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9119 00000458 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9120                                  noadj:					
  9121 0000045B F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9122 0000045C 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9123                                  
  9124                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9125                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9126                                  
  9127 0000045E D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9128 00000460 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9129 00000462 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9130 00000464 B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9131 00000467 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9132 00000469 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9133 0000046B F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9134 0000046D 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9135                                  
  9136                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9137                                  
  9138 0000046F 50                      		push	ax
  9139 00000470 89F0                    		mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9140 00000472 AB                      		stosw
  9141 00000473 58                      		pop	ax
  9142 00000474 AB                      		stosw
  9143 00000475 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9144 00000477 AB                      		stosw
  9145 00000478 F8                      		clc
  9146 00000479 C3                      		retn
  9147                                  
  9148                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9149                                  
  9150                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9151                                  
  9152                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9153                                  ;
  9154                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9155                                  ;
  9156                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9157                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9158                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9159                                  ;
  9160                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9161                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9162                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9163                                  ;			else
  9164                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9165                                  ;		}
  9166                                  ;
  9167                                  ; USES : AX
  9168                                  ;
  9169                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9170                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9171                                  ;
  9172                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9173                                  
  9174                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9175                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9176 0000047A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9177 0000047C CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9178                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9179                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9180                                  					; midnight
  9181                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9182 0000047E 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9183 00000483 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9184 00000485 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9185                                  					; and not flag
  9186 00000487 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9187 0000048B C3                      		retn
  9188                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9189                                  
  9190                                  inc_case:				
  9191 0000048C 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9192 0000048E 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9193 00000490 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9194                                  no_rollover:				
  9195 00000494 C3                      		retn
  9196

  9224                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9225                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9226                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9227                                  
  9228                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9229                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9230                                  
  9231                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9232                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9233                                  
  9234                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9235                                  
  9236                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9237                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9238                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9239                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9240                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9241                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9242                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9243                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9244                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9245                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9246                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9247                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9248                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9249                                  
  9250                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9251                                  
  9252                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9253                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9254                                  ;
  9255                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9256                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9257                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9258                                  ;   else
  9259                                  ;	set slow = value
  9260                                  ;   ...
  9261                                  ;*********************************************
  9262                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9263                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9264                                  ;*	 use slow
  9265                                  ;*   else
  9266                                  ;*	 use fast
  9267                                  ;*********************************************
  9268                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9269                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9270                                  ;	use slow
  9271                                  ;   else
  9272                                  ;	use fast
  9273                                  ;   ...
  9274                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9275                                  ;
  9276                                  ;
  9277                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9278                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9279                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9280                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9281                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9282                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9283                                  
  9284                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9285                                  
  9286                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9287                                  
  9288                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9289

  9295

  9364                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9365                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9366                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9367                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  9368                                  ;
  9369                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
  9370                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9371                                  
  9372                                  SetDrive:	
  9373                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
  9374 000004CB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022

  9393                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed

  9474                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9475                                  
  9476                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9477                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9478                                  ; drive.
  9479                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9480                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9481                                  ; returns in si:
  9482                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9483                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9484                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9485                                  ;
  9486                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9487                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9488                                  
  9489                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9490                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9491 00000553 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9492 00000556 E821FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9493 00000559 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9494                                  					; get stored time
  9495 0000055D 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9496 0000055F 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9497 00000563 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9498 00000565 751A                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9499 00000567 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9500 00000569 7511                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9501 0000056B FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9502 0000056F 803E[1D01]05            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9503                                  					; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9504 00000574 720C                    		jb	short timecheck_ret
  9505 00000576 FE0E[1D01]              		dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9506 0000057A EB05                    		jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9507                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9508                                  
  9509                                  timepassed:				
  9510 0000057C 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
  9511                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
  9512 0000057F 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
  9513                                  
  9514                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
  9515                                  timecheck_unk:				
  9516 00000581 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
  9517                                  timecheck_ret:				
  9518 00000582 C3                      		retn

  9634                                  		;;test	byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbig

  9639                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
  9640                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
  9641                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
  9642                                  			; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags

  9649                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
  9650                                  			;
  9651                                  			; Same BUG is existing in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:06C3h
  9652                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
  9653                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023)

  9681                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9682                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9683                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9684                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9685                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9686                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9687                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9688                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9689                                  ;
  9690                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9691                                  ;
  9692                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9693                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9694                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9695                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9696                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9697                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9698                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9699                                  ;
  9700                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9701                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9702                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9703                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9704                                  
  9705                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
  9706                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
  9707 000005F8 26F6452305              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 5
  9708 000005FD 7403                    		jz	short getbp1	; getbp1
  9709 000005FF E99500                  		jmp	getret_exit

  9711                                  
  9712                                  getbp1:

  9714 00000603 52                      		push	dx
  9715 00000604 53                      		push	bx
  9716                                  
  9717                                  		; attempt to read in boot sector and determine bpb.
  9718                                  		; we assume that the 2.x and greater dos disks all
  9719                                  		; have a valid boot sector.
  9720                                  
  9721 00000605 E8A400                  		call	readbootsec
  9722 00000608 7209                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg ; carry set if there was error.
  9723 0000060A 09DB                    		or	bx, bx		; bx is	0 if boot sector is valid.
  9724 0000060C 7508                    		jnz	short dofatbpb
  9725 0000060E E8F000                  		call	movbpb		; move bpb into	registers
  9726 00000611 EB57                    		jmp	short Has1

  9728                                  
  9729                                  getbp_err_ret_brdg:			
  9730 00000613 E98200                  		jmp	getbp_err_ret

  9732                                  
  9733                                  		; we have a 1.x diskette. In this case read in the fat ID byte
  9734                                  		; and fill in bpb from there.
  9735                                  dofatbpb:				
  9736 00000616 E85401                  		call	readfat		; puts media descriptor	byte in	ah
  9737 00000619 72F8                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg
  9738                                  		;cmp	ds:fhave96, 0	;  changeline support available?

  9742                                  					; jump to has1!!!!!! or	has720K

  9845                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9846                                  
  9847                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9848                                  
  9849                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9850                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
  9851                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
  9852                                  ;
  9853                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
  9854                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9855                                  
  9856                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9857                                  
  9858                                  readbootsec:	
  9859 000006AC B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
  9860 000006AE B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
  9861 000006B1 E8C600                  		call	read_sector
  9862 000006B4 724A                    		jb	short err_ret
  9863 000006B6 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
  9864                                  
  9865                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
  9866                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
  9867                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
  9868                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
  9869                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
  9870                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
  9871                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
  9872                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
  9873                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
  9874                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
  9875                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
  9876                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
  9877                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
  9878                                  		; informations
  9879                                  
  9880                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
  9881                                  
  9882                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9883 000006B8 803E[4E01]69            		cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
  9884 000006BD 7415                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
  9885 000006BF 803E[4E01]E9            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
  9886 000006C4 740E                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
  9887 000006C6 803E[4E01]EB            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
  9888 000006CB 7531                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9889 000006CD 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
  9890 000006D2 752A                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9891                                  
  9892                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9893                                  ;
  9894                                  ;; 10/03/2019
  9895                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
  9896                                  ;;
  9897                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
  9898                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
  9899                                  ;;
  9900                                  ;;check_signature:
  9901                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
  9902                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
  9903                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
  9904                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
  9905                                  
  9906                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
  9907                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
  9908                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
  9909                                  
  9910                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9911                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
  9912 000006D4 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9913                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9914 000006D7 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
  9915 000006D9 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
  9916 000006DB 7521                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9917                                  
  9918                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
  9919                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
  9920                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
  9921                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
  9922                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
  9923                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
  9924                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
  9925                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
  9926                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
  9927                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
  9928                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
  9929                                  
  9930                                  checksinglesided:
  9931 000006DD A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9932 000006E0 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
  9933 000006E2 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
  9934 000006E4 A801                    		test	al, 1
  9935 000006E6 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
  9936 000006E8 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
  9937 000006EE 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
  9938 000006F0 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
  9939 000006F5 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
  9940                                  
  9941                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
  9942                                  
  9943                                  mustbeearlier:				
  9944 000006F7 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
  9945                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9946 000006FC EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
  9947                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9948                                  
  9949                                  invalidbootsec:				
  9950 000006FE 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
  9951                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9952                                  movbpb_ret:
  9953                                  gooddsk:				
  9954 000006FF F8                      		clc
  9955                                  err_ret:
  9956 00000700 C3                      		retn
  9957                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9958                                  
  9959                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9960                                  ;err_ret:				
  9961                                  		;retn
  9962                                  
  9963                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9964                                  
  9965                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9966                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9967                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
  9968                                  ; getbp routine at has1
  9969                                  ;
  9970                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
  9971                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
  9972                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
  9973                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
  9974                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
  9975                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
  9976                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9977                                  
  9978                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9979                                  
  9980                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9981                                  movbpb:	
  9982 00000701 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
  9983                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9984                                  					; sectors per unit
  9985 00000705 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
  9986                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
  9987                                  					; number of directory entries
  9988 00000709 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
  9989                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
  9990                                  					; size of drive
  9991 0000070D 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
  9992                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9993                                  					; media	descriptor
  9994 00000711 A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
  9995                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
  9996                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  9997 00000714 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
  9998                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
  9999                                  					; sectors per track
 10000 00000718 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 10001                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10002                                  					; number of heads
 10003 0000071C 803E[0A05]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 10004 00000721 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10005 00000723 E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 10006 00000726 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 10007 00000728 C606[0A05]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 10008                                  movbpb_conv:				
 10009 0000072D 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 10010 00000732 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10011 00000734 E8D411                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 10012                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10013                                  		; cf = 0
 10014                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 10015                                  		;clc
 10016 00000737 C3                      		retn

 10018                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10019                                  
 10020                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10021                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10022                                  ;by es:di.
 10023                                  
 10024                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10025                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.

 10075                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10076                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10077                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10078                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10079                                  ; output:

 10081                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
