 13155                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13156                                  
 13157                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13158                                  
 13159                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13160                                  ;
 13161                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13162                                  ;
 13163                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13164                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13165                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13166                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13167                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13168                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13169                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13170                                  ;
 13171                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13172                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13173                                  ;
 13174                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13175                                  
 13176                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13177                                  HMAPtr:
 13178 000013C4 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13179                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13180 000013C9 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13181                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13182 000013CD 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13183 000013D0 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13184 000013D2 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13185                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13186 000013D7 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13187 000013D9 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13188                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13189 000013DD 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13190                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13191                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13192 000013E1 C3                      		retn
 13193                                  
 13194                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13195                                  
 13196                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13197                                  
 13198                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13199                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13200                                  
 13201                                  move_sector:
 13202                                  
 13203                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13204                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13205                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13206                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13207                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13208                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13209                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13210                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13211                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13212                                  ;
 13213                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13214                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13215                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13216                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13217                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13218                                  
 13219 000013E2 FC                      		cld
 13220 000013E3 51                      		push	cx
 13221 000013E4 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13222 000013E7 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13223 000013EB 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13224 000013ED 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13225 000013F1 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13226 000013F3 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13227 000013F5 59                      		pop	cx
 13228 000013F6 C3                      		retn
 13229                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13230                                  
 13231                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13232 000013F7 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13233 000013F9 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13234 000013FB 59                      		pop	cx
 13235 000013FC C3                      		retn
 13236                                  
 13237                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13238                                  
 13239                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13240                                  
 13241                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13242                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13243                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13244                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13245                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13246                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13247                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13248                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13249                                  ;
 13250                                  ; input conditions:
 13251                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13252                                  ;
 13253                                  ; output:
 13254                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13255                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13256                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13257                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13258                                  
 13259                                  check_wrap:	
 13260 000013FD 50                      		push	ax
 13261 000013FE 53                      		push	bx
 13262 000013FF 06                      		push	es
 13263 00001400 57                      		push	di
 13264 00001401 E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13265 00001404 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13266                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13267 00001406 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13268                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13269 0000140B 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13270 0000140D 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13271 00001411 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13272 00001413 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13273 00001416 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13274 00001418 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13275 0000141A F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13276                                  
 13277                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13278                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13279                                  
 13280 0000141C 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13281 0000141E 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13282                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13283 00001420 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13284 00001421 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13285                                  					; if on	boundary
 13286                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13287                                  not_on_bound:				
 13288 00001423 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13289 00001426 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13290 00001428 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13291 0000142A 40                      		inc	ax
 13292 0000142B 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13293 0000142D 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13294 00001430 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13295                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13296 00001434 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13297 00001436 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13298 00001437 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13299 00001439 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13300 0000143D F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13301                                  
 13302                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13303                                  
 13304 0000143F 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13305 00001441 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13306 00001443 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13307                                  
 13308                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13309                                  
 13310 00001445 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13311 00001447 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13312 00001449 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13313                                  no_head_bound:				
 13314 0000144A 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13315 0000144C 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13316 0000144D FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13317 0000144F 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13318 00001451 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13319 00001453 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13320 00001456 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13321 00001458 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13322 0000145A D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13323 0000145C 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13324 0000145E 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13325 00001460 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13326 00001462 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13327 00001464 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13328                                  no_wrap:				
 13329 00001466 F8                      		clc
 13330 00001467 5F                      		pop	di
 13331 00001468 07                      		pop	es
 13332 00001469 5B                      		pop	bx
 13333 0000146A 58                      		pop	ax
 13334 0000146B C3                      		retn
 13335                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13336                                  
 13337                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13338 0000146C 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13339 0000146E FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13340 00001470 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13341                                  
 13342                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13343                                  
 13344                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13345                                  
 13346                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13347                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13348                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13349                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13350                                  ;
 13351                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13352                                  
 13353                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13354                                  find_bds:	
 13355 00001472 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13356                                  fbds_1:					
 13357 00001476 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13358 0000147A 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13359 0000147C 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13360                                  					; go to next bds
 13361 0000147F 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13362 00001482 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13363 00001484 F9                      		stc
 13364                                  fdbs_2:					
 13365 00001485 C3                      		retn
 13366                                  
 13367                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13368                                  
 13369                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13370                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13371                                  doint:
 13372                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13373 00001486 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13374                                  					; get physical drive number
 13375                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13376                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13377                                  		
 13378 00001489 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13379 0000148B 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13380 0000148D 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13381                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13382 0000148F 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13383                                  					; get request code
 13384                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13385 00001492 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13386                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13387 00001495 9D                      		popf
 13388                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13389                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13390 00001496 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13391                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13392                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13393 0000149B 9C                      		pushf
 13394                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13395 0000149C 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13396                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13397                                  dointdone:				
 13398 0000149F C3                      		retn
 13399                                  
 13400                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13401                                  
 13402                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13403                                  
 13404                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13405                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13406                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13407                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13408                                  ;
 13409                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13410                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13411                                  ;
 13412                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13413                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13414                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13415                                  
 13416                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13417                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13418                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13419                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13420                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13421                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13422                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13423                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13424                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13425                                  ;end struc
 13426                                  
 13427                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13428                                  
 13429                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13430                                  ;	ah = function
 13431                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13432                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13433                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13434                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13435                                  ;   output conditions:
 13436                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13437                                  
 13438                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13439                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13440                                  ;
 13441                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13442                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13443                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13444                                  
 13445                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13446                                  
 13447                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13448                                  
 13449 000014A0 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13450                                  
 13451                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13452                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13453                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13454                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13455                                  
 13456                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13457                                  
 13458                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13459                                  
 13460                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13461                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13462                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13463                                  
 13464                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13465 000014A4 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13466 000014A9 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13467 000014AB 53                      		push	bx
 13468 000014AC BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13469 000014AF E83804                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13470 000014B2 5B                      		pop	bx
 13471 000014B3 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13472                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13473                                  
 13474                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13475                                  
 13476                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13477                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13478                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13479                                  
 13480                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13481                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13482 000014B5 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13483 000014B7 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13484 000014B9 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13485 000014BA 51                      		push	cx
 13486 000014BB 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13487 000014BD B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13488 000014BF D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13489 000014C1 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13490 000014C5 59                      		pop	cx
 13491 000014C6 58                      		pop	ax
 13492 000014C7 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13493                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13494 000014C9 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13495 000014CA 06                      		push	es
 13496                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13497 000014CB 2EC41E[A014]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13498                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13499                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13500 000014D0 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13501 000014D2 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13502 000014D5 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13503                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13504                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13505 000014D9 07                      		pop	es
 13506 000014DA 5B                      		pop	bx
 13507 000014DB EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13508                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13509                                  
 13510                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13511                                  
 13512                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13513                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13514                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13515                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13516                                  
 13517                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13518 000014DD 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13519                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13520 000014E2 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13521 000014E4 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13522                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13523 000014E9 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13524                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13525 000014EB 50                      		push	ax
 13526 000014EC B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13527                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13528                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13529 000014EE 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13530                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13531                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13532 000014F3 58                      		pop	ax
 13533 000014F4 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13534                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13535                                  
 13536                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13537                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13538                                  
 13539                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13540                                  
 13541                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13542                                  
 13543                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13544                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13545                                  
 13546                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13547 000014F6 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13548                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13549                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13550 000014F7 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13551                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13552                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13553                                  
 13554                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13555                                  
 13556 000014FC A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13557 000014FF 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13558 00001502 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13559                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13560                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13561 00001504 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13562 00001509 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13563                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13564                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13565                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13566 0000150B 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13567                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13568                                  		
 13569 00001510 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13570                                  		
 13571 00001511 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13572                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13573 00001516 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13574                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13575                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13576 00001518 9D                      		popf
 13577 00001519 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13578                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13579 0000151B 1F                      		pop	ds
 13580 0000151C CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13581                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13582                                  
 13583                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13584                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13585                                  ; a changeline error.
 13586                                  
 13587                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13588 0000151F 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13589                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13590 00001521 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13591 00001524 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13592 00001526 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13593 00001528 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13594 0000152A 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13595 0000152F 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13596                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13597                                  					; never	would
 13598 00001531 53                      		push	bx
 13599 00001532 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13600 00001535 E8B203                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13601 00001538 5B                      		pop	bx
 13602                                  int13b:					
 13603 00001539 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13604 0000153A EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13605                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13606                                  
 13607                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13608                                  
 13609                                  goterr13:				
 13610 0000153C 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13611 0000153F 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13612                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13613 00001541 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13614 00001544 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13615 00001546 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13616 0000154B 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13617                                  
 13618 0000154D 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13619                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13620                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13621                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13622 00001552 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13623                                  
 13624 00001554 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13625                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13626                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13627 00001556 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13628                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13629                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13630 0000155B A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13631 0000155E 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13632 00001560 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13633 00001562 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13634 00001564 53                      		push	bx
 13635 00001565 51                      		push	cx
 13636 00001566 52                      		push	dx
 13637 00001567 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13638                                  loop_ecc:				
 13639 0000156A B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13640                                  
 13641                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13642                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13643                                  ;
 13644                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13645                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13646                                  ; track.
 13647                                  ;
 13648                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13649                                  ; this request.
 13650                                  ;
 13651                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13652                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13653                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13654                                  ;
 13655 0000156D E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13656                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13657                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13658 00001570 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13659                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13660 00001575 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13661 00001577 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13662 0000157A 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13663 0000157C 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13664 0000157F 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13665                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13666                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13667                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13668 00001581 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13669                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13670                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13671                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13672                                  ok11_op:				
 13673 00001583 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13674 00001587 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13675 00001589 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13676                                  					; add 200h to address
 13677 0000158B FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13678 0000158D FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13679 0000158F EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13680                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13681                                  
 13682                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13683                                  
 13684                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13685 00001591 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13686                                  ok11_exit:				
 13687 00001592 5A                      		pop	dx
 13688 00001593 59                      		pop	cx
 13689 00001594 5B                      		pop	bx
 13690 00001595 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13691                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13692                                  
 13693                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13694                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13695                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13696                                  
 13697                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13698 00001597 06                      		push	es
 13699 00001598 53                      		push	bx
 13700 00001599 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13701 0000159C 1E                      		push	ds
 13702 0000159D 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13703 0000159E B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13704                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13705                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13706 000015A1 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13707                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13708 000015A6 5B                      		pop	bx
 13709 000015A7 07                      		pop	es
 13710 000015A8 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13711 000015AA 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13712 000015AD 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13713                                  
 13714                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13715                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13716                                  
 13717                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13718 000015AF 56                      		push	si
 13719 000015B0 57                      		push	di
 13720 000015B1 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13721 000015B3 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13722 000015B6 E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 13723 000015B9 5F                      		pop	di
 13724 000015BA 5E                      		pop	si
 13725 000015BB EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13726                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13727                                  
 13728                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13729                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13730                                  
 13731                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13732 000015BD A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13733 000015C0 FB                      		sti
 13734 000015C1 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13735 000015C4 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13736                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13737                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13738 000015C6 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13739 000015C9 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13740 000015CB 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13741 000015CE 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13742 000015D0 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13743                                  
 13744                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13745                                  
 13746                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13747                                  
 13748 000015D2 52                      		push	dx
 13749 000015D3 51                      		push	cx
 13750 000015D4 53                      		push	bx
 13751 000015D5 50                      		push	ax
 13752 000015D6 55                      		push	bp
 13753 000015D7 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13754 000015D9 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13755 000015DB D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13756 000015DD D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13757 000015DF D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13758 000015E1 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13759 000015E3 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13760 000015E5 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13761                                  
 13762                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13763                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13764                                  
 13765 000015E9 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13766 000015EB E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13767                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13768                                  
 13769                                  no_skip_first:				
 13770 000015EE D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13771 000015F0 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13772 000015F2 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13773                                  
 13774                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13775                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13776                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13777                                  ;
 13778                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13779                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13780                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13781                                  ; in error.
 13782                                  
 13783 000015F4 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13784 000015F6 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13785                                  
 13786                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13787                                  
 13788 000015F8 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13789                                  					; set up head number
 13790 000015FB E888FE                  		call	doint
 13791 000015FE E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13792                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13793                                  
 13794                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13795 00001601 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13796 00001603 F9                      		stc
 13797 00001604 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 13798                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 13799                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13800                                  
 13801                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 13802                                  
 13803                                  intverify:				
 13804 00001607 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 13805 00001608 53                      		push	bx
 13806 00001609 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 13807 0000160A 07                      		pop	es
 13808                                  dosimple:				
 13809 0000160B BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13810                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 13811                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 13812                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13813 0000160E 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13814                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13815 00001613 5B                      		pop	bx
 13816 00001614 07                      		pop	es
 13817 00001615 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13818                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13819                                  
 13820                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 13821                                  
 13822                                  intformat:				
 13823 00001618 06                      		push	es
 13824 00001619 53                      		push	bx
 13825 0000161A 56                      		push	si
 13826 0000161B 57                      		push	di
 13827 0000161C 1E                      		push	ds
 13828                                  
 13829                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 13830                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 13831                                  
 13832 0000161D 06                      		push	es
 13833 0000161E 1E                      		push	ds
 13834 0000161F 07                      		pop	es
 13835 00001620 1F                      		pop	ds
 13836 00001621 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 13837 00001623 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 13838 00001626 E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 13839 00001629 1F                      		pop	ds
 13840 0000162A 5F                      		pop	di
 13841 0000162B 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 13842 0000162C EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 13843                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13844                                  
 13845                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 13846                                  ; the first block.
 13847                                  ;
 13848                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 13849                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 13850                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 13851                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 13852                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 13853                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 13854                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 13855                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 13856                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 13857                                  
 13858                                  doblock:
 13859                                  
 13860                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 13861                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 13862                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 13863                                  				
 13864 0000162E 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13865                                  					; get head #, drive #
 13866 00001631 51                      		push	cx
 13867 00001632 06                      		push	es
 13868 00001633 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13869                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 13870 00001634 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 13871 00001637 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13872                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13873 0000163B 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13874                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13875 00001640 5F                      		pop	di
 13876 00001641 07                      		pop	es
 13877 00001642 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 13878 00001644 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 13879 00001646 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 13880 00001648 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13881                                  doblockflop:				
 13882 0000164A 59                      		pop	cx
 13883                                  doblockcontinue:			
 13884 0000164B 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 13885 0000164D 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 13886 0000164F 50                      		push	ax
 13887 00001650 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 13888 00001652 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 13889                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13890                                  
 13891                                  doblocklast:				
 13892 00001654 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 13893 00001656 50                      		push	ax
 13894                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 13895 00001657 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 13896 0000165A 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 13897 0000165C 58                      		pop	ax
 13898 0000165D 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 13899                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 13900 00001660 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 13901 00001662 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 13902 00001664 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 13903 00001666 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 13904 00001668 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 13905                                  					; then we are done already.
 13906 0000166A 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 13907                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 13908 0000166C E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 13909 0000166F EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 13910                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13911                                  
 13912                                  bufferx:				
 13913 00001671 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13914                                  					; set up head number
 13915                                  buffer:					
 13916 00001674 53                      		push	bx
 13917 00001675 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13918 00001678 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 13919 0000167B 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 13920                                  					
 13921                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 13922                                  
 13923 0000167D 06                      		push	es
 13924 0000167E 1E                      		push	ds
 13925 0000167F 56                      		push	si
 13926 00001680 57                      		push	di
 13927 00001681 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 13928 00001682 06                      		push	es
 13929 00001683 1F                      		pop	ds
 13930 00001684 07                      		pop	es
 13931 00001685 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 13932 00001688 57                      		push	di		; save it
 13933 00001689 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 13934 0000168B E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 13935 0000168E 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 13936                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 13937 0000168F 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 13938 00001690 5E                      		pop	si
 13939 00001691 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 13940                                  
 13941                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 13942                                  
 13943 00001692 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13944                                  					; get drive number
 13945 00001694 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 13946 00001697 E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 13947                                  					;
 13948                                  					; ah is	function
 13949                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 13950                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 13951                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 13952                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 13953                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 13954 0000169A E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 13955 0000169D 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 13956 0000169E 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 13957 000016A0 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 13958                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13959                                  
 13960                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 13961                                  
 13962                                  doread:					
 13963 000016A2 06                      		push	es
 13964 000016A3 53                      		push	bx
 13965 000016A4 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 13966 000016A5 07                      		pop	es
 13967 000016A6 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13968 000016A9 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 13969 000016AB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13970                                  					; get drive number
 13971 000016AE E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 13972                                  					; ah = function
 13973                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 13974                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 13975                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 13976 000016B1 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 13977 000016B4 5B                      		pop	bx
 13978 000016B5 07                      		pop	es
 13979 000016B6 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 13980 000016B8 56                      		push	si
 13981 000016B9 57                      		push	di
 13982 000016BA 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13983 000016BC BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13984 000016BF E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 13985 000016C2 5F                      		pop	di
 13986 000016C3 5E                      		pop	si
 13987                                  
 13988                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 13989                                  
 13990                                  dotail:					
 13991 000016C4 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 13992 000016C5 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 13993 000016C8 41                      		inc	cx
 13994 000016C9 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 13995 000016CC F8                      		clc
 13996 000016CD FEC8                    		dec	al
 13997 000016CF 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 13998                                  
 13999                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14000                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14001                                  
 14002 000016D1 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14003 000016D4 E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14004 000016D7 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14005                                  
 14006                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14007                                  
 14008                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14009                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14010                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14011                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14012                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14013                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14014                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14015                                  
 14016                                  bad13:					
 14017 000016DA 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14018 000016DC 5D                      		pop	bp
 14019 000016DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 14020 000016DE 5B                      		pop	bx
 14021 000016DF 59                      		pop	cx
 14022 000016E0 5A                      		pop	dx
 14023 000016E1 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14024 000016E3 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14025                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14026                                  
 14027                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14028 000016E6 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14029                                  
 14030                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14031                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14032                                  		;db 	0
 14033                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14034                                  
 14035                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 14036                                  
 14037                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14038                                  
 14039                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14040                                  ; MSBIO2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 14041                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14042                                  ; 17/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14043                                  
 14044                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14045                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 14046 000016E9 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 14047 000016ED BF[8706]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 14048 000016F0 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 14049 000016F1 07                      		pop	es
 14050 000016F2 E9C3EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 14051                                  
 14052                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14053                                  
 14054                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14055                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14056                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14057                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14058                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14059                                  
 14060                                  install_bds:		
 14061 000016F5 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14062 000016F6 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14063                                  
 14064                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14065                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14066                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14067 000016F9 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14068                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14069 000016FB 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14070 000016FF 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14071                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14072 00001702 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14073 00001704 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14074 00001706 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14075                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14076 0000170A 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14077 0000170D 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14078                                  					; we don't own it
 14079 00001712 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14080                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14081 00001715 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14082 00001718 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14083                                  next_bds:				
 14084 0000171C 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14085                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14086 0000171F 75D8                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14087 00001721 8C4402                  		mov	word [si+2], es ; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14088                                  					; install bds
 14089 00001724 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14090 00001726 26C705FFFF              		mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14091                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14092 0000172B 1F                      		pop	ds
 14093                                  
 14094                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14095                                  ;
 14096                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14097                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14098                                  ;
 14099                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14100                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14101                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14102                                  ;
 14103                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14104                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14105                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14106                                  
 14107 0000172C C3                      		retn
 14108                                  
 14109                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 14114                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14115                                  DRVLET equ drvlet
 14116                                  SNGMSG equ sngmsg

 14127 0000172D F606[CE08]01            swpdsk:		test	byte [IsWin386], 1			
 14128                                  		;test	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Is win386 present?
 14129 00001732 7405                    		jz	short no_win386	; no, skip SetFocus
 14130                                  		
 14131                                  		; set focus to the correct VM
 14132                                  		;;call	far 70h:8D1h	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:179Ah
 14133                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14134 00001734 9A[CF08]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14135                                  		;call	far ptr	V86_Crit_SetFocus ; call far 70h:8D1h
 14136                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14137                                  no_win386:				
 14138 00001739 51                      		push	cx
 14139 0000173A 52                      		push	dx
 14140 0000173B 268A5505                		mov	dl, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 14141                                  					; get the drive	letter
 14142

 14144                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa

 14146 0000173F 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl
 14147 00001741 80F601                  		xor	dh, 1
 14148 00001744 29C9                    		sub	cx, cx		; nobody has handled swap disk
 14149 00001746 B8004A                  		mov	ax, 4A00h	; multMULT<<8)|multMULTSWPDSK

 14151                                  					; Broadcast it

 14155

 14171                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si]
 14172                                  wrmsg_loop:

 14174                                  					; AL = character to display
