 15282                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15283                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 15284                                  
 15285                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 15286                                  
 15287                                  struc buffinfo
 15288 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 15289 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 15290 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15291                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 15292                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 15293 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 15294                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 15295                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 15296                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 15297                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 15298                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 15299                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 15300                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 15301                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 15302 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15303                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 15304 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 15305 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 15306 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 15307 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 15308 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 15309                                  .size:
 15310                                  endstruc
 15311                                  
 15312                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 15313                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 15314                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 15315                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 15316                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 15317                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 15318                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 15319                                  
 15320                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 15321                                  
 15322                                  
 15323                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 15324                                  
 15325                                  ;Flag byte masks
 15326                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 15327                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 15328                                  ;***
 15329                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 15330                                  ;***
 15331                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 15332                                  
 15333                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 15334                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 15335                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 15336                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 15337                                  
 15338                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz

 15342                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15343                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 15344                                  
 15345                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 15346                                  
 15347                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 15348                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 15349                                  ;
 15350                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 15351                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 15352                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 15353                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 15354                                  ;
 15355                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 15356                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 15357                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 15358                                  
 15359                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 15360                                  
 15361                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15362                                  
 15363                                  struc	DPB
 15364 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 15365 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 15366 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 15367 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 15368 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 15369 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 15370 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 15371 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 15372 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 15373 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 15374                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15375 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 15376 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 15377 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 15378 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 15379 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 15380                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 15381 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 15382 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 15383 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 15384                                  .size:
 15385                                  endstruc
 15386                                  
 15387                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 15388                                  
 15389                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)

 15446                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15447                                  
 15448                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15449                                  ;
 15450                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15451                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15452                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15453                                  ;
 15454                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15455                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15456                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15457                                  ;
 15458                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15459                                  
 15460                                  struc A_BPB
 15461 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15462 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15463 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15464 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15465 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 15466 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15467 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 15468 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 15469 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 15470 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 15471 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 15472 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 15473 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15474 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 15475 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 15476                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 15477                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 15478                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 15479                                  .size:
 15480                                  endstruc
 15481

 15551                                  
 15552                                  struc PDB	; Process_data_block
 15553 00000000 ????                    .EXIT_CALL:	resw 1   	; INT int_abort system terminate
 15554 00000002 ????                    .BLOCK_LEN:	resw 1		; size of execution block
 15555 00000004 ??                                      resb 1
 15556 00000005 ??????????              .CPM_CALL:	resb 5		; ancient call to system
 15557 0000000A ????????                .EXIT:		resd 1		; pointer to exit routine
 15558 0000000E ????????                .CTRL_C:	resd 1		; pointer to ^C routine
 15559 00000012 ????????                .FATAL_ABORT:	resd 1		; pointer to fatal error

 15739                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15740                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 15741                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15742                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 15743                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 15744                                  									  
 15745                                  ;*******************************					  
 15746                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 15747                                  ;*******************************					  
 15748                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 15749                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 15750                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 15751                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15752                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 15753                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 15754                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15755                                  ;For all others:							  
 15756                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 15757                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 15758                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 15759                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 15760                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 15761                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 15762                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 15763                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 15764                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15765                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 15766                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 15767                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 15768                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 15769                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 15770                                  ;									  
 15771                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 15772                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 15773                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15774                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 15775                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 15776                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 15777                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 15778                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 15779                                  ;									  
 15780                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 15781                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 15782                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 15783                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 15784                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 15785                                  ;									  
 15786                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 15787                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 15788                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 15789                                  ;									  
 15790                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 15791                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 15792                                  ;									  
 15793                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 15794                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 15795                                  ;									  
 15796                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 15797                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 15798                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 15799                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 15800                                  ;						called. 		  
 15801                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 15802                                  ;									  
 15803                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15804                                  ;									  
 15805                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15806                                  ;									  
 15807                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15808                                  ;									  
 15809                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15810                                  ;									  
 15811                                  
 15812                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 15813                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 15814 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 15815 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 15816                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 15817 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15818 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15819 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 15820 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 15821                                  endstruc

 15930                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15931                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15932                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15933                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15934                                  
 15935                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 15936                                  ;
 15937                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 15938                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 15939                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 15940                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 15941                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 15942                                  ;
 15943                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 15944                                  ;
 15945                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 15946                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 15947                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 15948                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 15949                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 15950                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 15951                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 15952                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 15953                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 15954                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 15955                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 15956                                  
 15957                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 15958                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 15959                                  
 15960                                  struc 		curdir_list
 15961                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15962 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 15963 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 15964 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 15965 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 15966 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 15967 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 15968                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 15969 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 15970 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 15971 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 15972                                  .size:
 15973                                  endstruc
 15974                                  
 15975                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 15976                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 15977                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 15978                                  						; argument
 15979                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 15980

 15985                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 15986                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 15987                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 15988                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 15990                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15991                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15992                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15993                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15994                                  
 15995                                  ; system file table
 15996                                  
 15997                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 15998                                  ;
 15999                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 16000                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 16001                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 16002                                  
 16003                                  struc	SF
 16004 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1

 16020                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 16021                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 16022                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 16023                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 16024                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 16025                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 16026                                  					;   (WRITE)
 16027                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 16028                                  					;
 16029                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 16030                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 16031                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 16032                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 16033                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 16034                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 16035                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16036                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16037                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16038                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device

 16040                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device

 16345                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 16346                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions

 16352                                  ; 05/07/2018
 16353                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16354                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16355                                  
 16356                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16357                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 16358                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16359                                  
 16360                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16361                                  ;
 16362                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16363                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16364                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16365                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16366                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16367                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16368                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16369                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16370                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16371                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16372                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16373                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16374                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16375                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16376                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16377                                  ;
 16378                                  
 16379                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16380                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16381                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16382                                  ;
 16383                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16384                                  ;
 16385                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 16386                                  ;
 16387                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 16388                                  ;
 16389                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 16390                                  ;
 16391                                  
 16392                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 16393                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 16394                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 16395                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 16396                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 16397                                  ;      deeply nested one
 16398                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 16399                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 16400                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 16401                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 16402                                  
 16403                                  		;EVEN
 16404                                  ;align 2
 16405                                  		; 21/10/2022
 16406                                  
 16407 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 16408 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 16409 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 16410 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 16411 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 16412 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 16413                                  
 16414 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16415 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16416 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16417                                  
 16418                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16419                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16420                                  
 16421                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16422                                  
 16423 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16424                                  
 16425                                  int02:
 16426                                  
 16427                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16428                                  ;
 16429                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16430                                  ;
 16431                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16432                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16433                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16434                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16435                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16436                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16437                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16438                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16439                                  ;
 16440                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16441                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16442                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16443                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16444                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16445                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16446                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16447                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16448                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16449                                  ;
 16450                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16451                                  
 16452 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 16453 00000017 06                      	push	es
 16454 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 16455 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 16456                                  	; 02/11/2022
 16457 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 16458 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 16459 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 16460                                  
 16461 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 16462                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 16463                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 16464                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 16465                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 16466 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 16467 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 16468                                  special02:
 16469 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 16470 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 16471                                  normal02:
 16472 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 16473 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 16474 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02
 16475                                  
 16476                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16477                                  
 16478 00000038 00000000                old08:	dd	0
 16479                                  
 16480                                  int08:
 16481 0000003C E80801                  	call	do_int_stacks
 16482 0000003F [3800]                  	dw	old08
 16483                                  
 16484                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16485                                  
 16486 00000041 00000000                old09:	dd	0
 16487                                  
 16488                                  int09:
 16489                                  
 16490                                  ; keyboard interrupt must have a three byte jump, a nop and a zero byte

 16702                                  ;********************************************************************
 16703                                  ;common routines
 16704                                  ;********************************************************************
 16705                                  
 16706                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 16707                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 16708                                  ; service routine
 16709                                  
 16710                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 16711                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16712                                  
 16713                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 16714                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 16715                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 16716                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 16717                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 16718                                  
 16719                                  do_int_stacks:
 16720 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 16721 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 16722 00000149 06                      	push	es
 16723 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 16724 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 16725 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 16726                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16727                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 16728                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16729 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 16730 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 16731 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 16732                                  
 16733 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 16734                                  
 16735                                  found02:
 16736 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 16737 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 16738                                  
 16739 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 16740                                  
 16741 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 16742                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16743                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 16744                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16745                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 16746 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 16747 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 16748                                  
 16749                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 16750                                  	;mov	es,bp
 16751                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 16752                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 16753                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 16754                                  	;mov	sp,es
 16755                                  	;mov	es,ax
 16756                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 16757                                  
 16758                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 16759 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 16760 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 16761 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 16762 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 16763 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 16764 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 16765 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 16766 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 16767                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16768                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 16769 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 16770                                  
 16771 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 16772                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16773 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 16774                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16775                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 16776                                  
 16777 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 16778                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16779 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 16780                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16781                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 16782 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 16783 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 16784                                  
 16785                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16786                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 16787                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16788 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 16789 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 16790                                  
 16791 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 16792 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 16793 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 16794 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 16795 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 16796                                  
 16797                                  notfree02:
 16798 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 16799 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 16800                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16801                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 16802                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16803 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16804                                  
 16805                                  findnext02:
 16806 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 16807 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 16808                                  
 16809                                  foundbad02:
 16810 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16811 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 16812 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 16813                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16814                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 16815                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16816 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 16817 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 16818                                  
 16819                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 16821                                  ; Common routines
 16822                                  
 16823                                  longpath:
 16824                                  	; 21/03/2019
 16825 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 16826                                  lploopp:
 16827                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16828                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 16829                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16830 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 16831 000001D4 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 16832                                  
 16833 000001D6 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 16834                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16835                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 16836                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16837 000001D8 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16838 000001DC 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 16839 000001DE 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 16840                                  
 16841 000001E0 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 16842 000001E2 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 16843                                  
 16844                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16845                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 16846                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16847 000001E4 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 16848                                  inuse:
 16849 000001E8 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16850 000001ED 7406                    	je	short fatal
 16851 000001EF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 16852 000001F2 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 16853                                  found:
 16854 000001F4 C3                      	retn
 16855                                  fatal:
 16856 000001F5 1E                      	push	ds
 16857 000001F6 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 16858 000001F9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 16859 000001FB 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 16860 00000200 1F                      	pop	ds
 16861 00000201 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 16862                                  
 16863 00000203 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 16864 00000205 E672                    	out	72h,al
 16865                                  
 16866                                  skip_nmis:
 16867 00000207 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 16868 00000208 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 16869 0000020A E621                    	out	021h,al
 16870 0000020C E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 16871                                  
 16872 0000020E 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 16873 00000210 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 16874 00000212 BE[3902]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 16875                                  ;SR;
 16876                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 16877                                  ;

 16879 00000216 1E                      	push	ds

 17448                                  ; The DOS code is ORGed at a non-zero value to allow it to be located in
 17449                                  ; HIMEM. Thus, the DOS segment location must be adjusted accordingly.
 17450                                  ; If this is ROMDOS, however, only the init code is loaded into RAM, so
 17451                                  ; this ORG is not done. The entry point is at offset zero in the segment.
 17452

 18059                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 18060                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 18061                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 18062                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 18063                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 18064                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 18065                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 18066                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 18067                                  ;
 18068                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 18069                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 18070                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 18071                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 18072                                  ; been patched.

 18358 000007DD BA[D534]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 18359                                  
 18360                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 18361                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 18362                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 18363                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 18364                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 18365                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 18366                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 18367                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 18368                                  
 18369                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 18370

 18382 000007F4 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 18383                                  
 18384                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 18385                                  
 18386                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 18387                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 18388                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 18389                                  
 18390                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18391                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)
 18392 000007F6 8B1E[9202]                      mov     bx,[MEMORY_SIZE] ; get location of end of memory
 18393 000007FA 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 18394                                  
 18395                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 18396                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 18397                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 18398                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 18399                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 18400                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 18401                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 18402                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 18403                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 18404                                  ;
 18405                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 18406                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 18407                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 18408                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 18409                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 18410                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 18411                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 18412                                  
 18413                                  	; 22/10/2022

 18796                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18797                                  ;
 18798                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 18799                                  ;
 18800                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 18801                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 18802                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 18803                                  ;
 18804                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 18805                                  ;
 18806                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18807                                  
 18808                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18809                                  MovDOSHi:
 18810                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18811                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18812                                  	; ds = cs
 18813 000008F3 E8D800                  	call	AllocHMA
 18814 000008F6 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; did we get HMA?
 18815 000008F8 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh
 18816 000008FB 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18817                                  
 18818                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18819                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 18820                                  
 18821                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 18822                                  	; 24/03/2019
 18823                                  	
 18824                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18825 000008FD E83400                  	call	MovBIOS				; First move BIOS into HMA
 18826                                  
 18827                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 18828                                  	
 18829                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18830                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18831                                  	;xor	di,di
 18832                                  	
 18833                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18834                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 18835                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18836                                  	; ds = cs
 18837 00000900 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 18838 00000904 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 18839                                  
 18840                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 18841                                  ;else
 18842                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 18843                                  ;
 18844                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0
 18845                                  ;
 18846                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS

 18849 0000090A F8                      	clc

 19126                                  AllocMemForDOS:
 19127                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19128                                  	; 14/05/2019

 19130                                  	; ds = cs
 19131                                  	;mov	ax,BCode_end

 19133                                  	; 23/10/2022

 19139                                  	; 02/11/2022

 19141                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19142                                  	; ds = cs
 19143 0000095D 0306[7F02]              	add	ax,[lo_doscod_size]
 19144 00000961 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 19145 00000964 E86702                  	call	off_to_para			; convert to para
 19146                                  	; 23/10/2022

 19148                                  	;inc	ax ; + 1 paragraph for MCB
 19149 00000967 09DB                    	or	bx,bx				; M012
 19150 00000969 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax				;  can we use int 21 for alloc
 19151 0000096B 741A                    	jz	short update_arena		; M012
 19152 0000096D B448                    	mov	ah,48h				; request DOS
 19153 0000096F CD21                    	int	21h
 19154 00000971 7250                    	jc	short FatalErr			; IF ERR WE ARE HOSED
 19155                                   	; 23/10/2022
 19156                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)
 19157 00000973 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				; Take care ORG 30h of
 19158                                  						;  BIOS code
 19159 00000976 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19160                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.OWNER],08h	; mark it as system
 19161                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.NAME],'SC'	;  code area
 19162                                  	; 14/05/2019
 19163                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],08h	; mark it as system
 19164                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'	;  code area
 19165                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19166 00000978 26C70621000800          	mov	word [es:20h+1],08h		; mark it as system
 19167 0000097F 26C70628005343          	mov	word [es:20h+8],'SC'		;  code area
 19168                                  
 19169 00000986 C3                      	retn
 19170                                  
 19171                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19172                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19173                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19174                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19175                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19176                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19177                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19178                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19179                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19180                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19181                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19182                                  ;
 19183                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19184                                  
 19185                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19186                                  update_arena:
 19187 00000987 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19188 00000988 57                      	push	di
 19189 00000989 51                      	push	cx
 19190 0000098A 52                      	push	dx
 19191                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19192                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19193                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19194                                  	; ds = cs 
 19195 0000098B C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19196 0000098F 4F                      	dec	di
 19197 00000990 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19198                                  						;  before sysvar
 19199 00000991 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19200                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19201 00000993 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19202 00000998 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19203 0000099A 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19204                                  
 19205                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19206 0000099C 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19207 000009A1 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19208 000009A3 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19209 000009A5 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19210 000009A7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19211                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19212 000009A9 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19213                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19214 000009AD C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19215 000009B3 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19216                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19217 000009B5 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19218 000009B9 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19219                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19220                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19221 000009BB 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19222 000009BE 5A                      	pop	dx
 19223 000009BF 59                      	pop	cx
 19224 000009C0 5F                      	pop	di
 19225 000009C1 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19226 000009C2 C3                      	retn
 19227                                  ;
 19228                                  ; M012 : END
 19229                                  ;
 19230                                  FatalErr:
 19231 000009C3 0E                      	push	cs

 19233 000009C5 BA[8D08]                	mov	dx,FEmsg
 19234 000009C8 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 19235 000009CA CD21                    	int	21h 		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 19236                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 19237                                          ;jmp	stall

 19239 000009CC FA                      	cli
 19240 000009CD F4                      	hlt

 19246                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19247                                  ;
 19248                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19249                                  ;
 19250                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19251                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19252                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19253                                  ;
 19254                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19255                                  ;
 19256                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19257                                  
 19258                                  AllocHMA:
 19259                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19260                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19261                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19262                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19263                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19264                                  
 19265                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19266                                  ;
 19267                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19268                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19269                                  ;	push	ax
 19270                                  ;	popf
 19271                                  ;	pushf
 19272                                  ;	pop	ax
 19273                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 19274                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 19275                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 19276                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 19277                                  
 19278                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19279                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 19280                                  
 19281 000009CE 1E                      	push	ds
 19282                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 19283                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 19284                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19285 000009CF B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 19286 000009D2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19287                                  
 19288 000009D4 E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 19289 000009D7 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 19290                                  
 19291 000009D9 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 19292 000009DC CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 19293                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 19294                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 19295                                  
 19296 000009DE 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 19297                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 19298 000009E2 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 19299                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 19300                                  
 19301 000009E6 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 19302 000009E8 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 19303                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19304 000009EB FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19305 000009EF 48                      	dec	ax
 19306 000009F0 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 19307                                  
 19308                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 19309                                  
 19310 000009F2 B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 19311 000009F4 CD15                    	int	15h
 19312                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 19313                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 19314                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 19315 000009F6 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 19316                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 19317                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19318 000009F9 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 19319                                  allocHMA_1:
 19320 000009FB B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 19321                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19322 000009FD FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19323 00000A01 48                      	dec	ax
 19324 00000A02 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 19325                                  
 19326 00000A04 E88901                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 19327 00000A07 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 19328                                  
 19329 00000A09 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19330 00000A0C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19331 00000A0E 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 19332 00000A15 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 19333                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 19334                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19335 00000A1C 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 19336                                  
 19337                                  ; 11/12/2022
 19338                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 19339                                  ;	; cf=0
 19340                                  ;	;clc
 19341                                  ;	pop	ds
 19342                                  ;	retn
 19343                                  
 19344                                  grabhma_error:
 19345 00000A1E F9                      	stc
 19346                                  	; 11/12/022
 19347                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 19348                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 19349 00000A1F 1F                      	pop	ds
 19350 00000A20 C3                      	retn
 19351                                  
 19352                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19353                                  ;
 19354                                  ; procedure : IsXMSLoaded
 19355                                  ;
 19356                                  ;             Checks whether a XMS driver is loaded
 19357                                  ;
 19358                                  ; Returns : Z flag set if XMS driver loaded
 19359                                  ;           Z flag reset if no XMS drivers are present
 19360                                  ;
 19361                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19362                                  
 19363                                  IsXMSLoaded:
 19364 00000A21 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 19365 00000A24 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 19366                                  				; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 19367                                  				; AL <> 80h no driver
 19368 00000A26 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h		; XMS installed?
 19369 00000A28 C3                      	retn

 19371                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19372                                  ; procedure : FTryToMovDOSHi
 19373                                  ;
 19374                                  ;		Called from HMA suballoc calls
 19375                                  ;	
 19376                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19377                                  
 19378                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19379                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A84h)
 19380                                  
 19381                                  FTryToMovDOSHi:	; proc	far
 19382                                  
 19383 00000A29 50                      	push	ax
 19384 00000A2A 53                      	push	bx
 19385 00000A2B 51                      	push	cx
 19386 00000A2C 52                      	push	dx

 19417                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19418                                  ;
 19419                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19420                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19421                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19422                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19423                                  ;
 19424                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19425                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19426                                  ;
 19427                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19428                                  
 19429                                  StartVDHead:
 19430                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19431                                  
 19432 00000A46 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19433 00000A4A 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19434 00000A4C 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19435 00000A4E 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19436 00000A50 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19437                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19438 00000A51 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19439                                  VDiskSig1:
 19440 00000A58 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19441                                  
 19442                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19443                                  
 19444 00000A5D 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19445                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19446 00000A63 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19447 00000A72 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19448 00000A74 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19449                                  VDInt19:
 19450 00000A75 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19451                                  OldVDInt19:
 19452 00000A76 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19453                                  
 19454                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19455                                  
 19456                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19457 00000A7A 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19458                                  VDiskSig2:
 19459 00000A7D 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19460                                  
 19461                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19462                                  
 19463 00000A82 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19464 00000A85 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19465 00000A87 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19466 00000A88 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19467 00000A8A 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19468 00000A8B 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19469 00000A8D 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19470 00000A8F FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19471 00000A90 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19472 00000A92 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19473 00000A94 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19474 00000A96 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19475 00000A98 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19476                                  
 19477                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte

 19481                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19482                                  ;
 19483                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19484                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19485                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19486                                  ;
 19487                                  ; Inputs : None
 19488                                  ;
 19489                                  ; Outputs : None
 19490                                  ;
 19491                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19492                                  ;
 19493                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 19615                                  
 19616                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19617                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19618                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19619                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19620                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19621                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19622                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19623                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19624                                  ;								      ;I070
 19625                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19626                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19627                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19628                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19629                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19630                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19631                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19632                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19633                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19634                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19635                                  ;								      ;I070
 19636                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19637                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070

 19682                                  ;		the offset.
