 20635                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20636                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20637                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20638                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20639                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20640                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20641                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20642                                  ;
 20643                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20644                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20645                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20646                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20647                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20648                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20649                                  ;
 20650                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20651                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20652                                  ;
 20653                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20654                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20655                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20656                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 20657                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 20658                                  ;
 20659                                  ;	for round-up machine
 20660                                  ;
 20661                                  ;			  none.
 20662                                  
 20663                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 20664                                  ;
 20665                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 20666                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 20667                                  
 20668                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20669                                  
 20670 00000F59 50                      	push	ax

 20729                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20730                                  ; allocate sysinit_base for install= command
 20731                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20732                                  ; sysinit_base allocation.
 20733                                  ;   check if endfile has been called to handle install= command.
 20734                                  
 20735                                  set_sysinit_base:
 20736                                  
 20737                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20738                                  ;sysinit_base will be established in the secure area of
 20739                                  ;lower memory when it handles the first install= command.
 20740                                  ;sysinit_base is the place where the actual exec function will be called and
 20741                                  ;will check sysinit module in high memory if it is damaged by the application
 20742                                  ;program.  if sysinit module has been broken,then "memory error..." message
 20743                                  ;is displayed by sysinit_base.

 20872                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20873                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 20874                                  ;
 20875                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 20876                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 20877                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 20878                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 20879                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 20880                                  ; program).
 20881                                  
 20882                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 20883                                  
 20884                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 20885                                  
 20886 00001041 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 20887                                  
 20888                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 20889                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 20890                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 20891                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 20892                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 20893                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 20894                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 20895                                  ; carridge return.
 20896                                  
 20897                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 20898                                  ;character after =.
 20899

 20901 00001043 1E                      	push	ds
 20902 00001044 07                      	pop	es
 20903 00001045 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 20904 00001046 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 20905                                  
 20906 00001048 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 20907 0000104A FC                      	cld
 20908 0000104B 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 20909 00001051 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 20910                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 20911 00001054 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 20912 00001055 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 20913 00001057 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 20914 00001059 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 20915                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 20916 0000105B AC                      	lodsb
 20917 0000105C 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 20918 0000105F 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 20919 00001061 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 20920 00001063 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 20921 00001065 47                      	inc	di
 20922 00001066 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 20923                                  done_installparm:
 20924 00001068 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 20925 0000106D 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 20926 00001070 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area

 20928                                  					; starts with cr.

 21019                                  
 21020                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21021                                  ;
 21022                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21023                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21024                                  ;
 21025                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21026                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21027                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21028                                  
 21029                                  ParaRound:
 21030 000010C1 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21031 000010C4 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21032 000010C6 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21033 000010C8 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21034 000010CA D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21035 000010CC C3                      	retn

 21037                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21038                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21039                                  ;
 21040                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21041                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21042                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21043                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21044                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21045                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21046                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21047                                  ;
 21048                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21049                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21050                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21051                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21052                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21053                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21054                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21055                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21056                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21057                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21058                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21059                                  ;
 21060                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21061                                  
 21062                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21063                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21064                                  sysinit_base:				
 21065 000010CD 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21066 000010D2 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21067 000010D7 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21068 000010D9 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21069 000010DE 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21070 000010E3 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21071 000010E4 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21072 000010E5 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21073                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21074                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21075 000010E7 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21076 000010EA 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21077 000010EF 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21078                                  
 21079                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21080                                  
 21081 000010F1 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21082 000010F3 0E                      	push	cs
 21083 000010F4 1F                      	pop	ds
 21084 000010F5 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21085 000010F8 CD21                    	int	21h
 21086                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21087                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21088                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21089                                  _stall: 
 21090                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21091 000010FA F4                      	hlt 
 21092                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21093                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21094 000010FB EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21095                                  
 21096                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21097 000010FD 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21098                                  
 21099                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21100                                  
 21101                                  sum_up:
 21102                                  
 21103                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21104                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21105                                  ;
 21106                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21107                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21108                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21109                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21110                                  ;
 21111                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21112                                  
 21113 00001102 1E                      	push	ds
 21114                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21115                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21116 00001103 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21117 00001107 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21118 00001109 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21119 0000110B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21120 0000110D 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21121                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21122 00001112 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21123 00001114 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21124                                  sum1:
 21125 00001116 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21126 00001118 46                      	inc	si
 21127 00001119 46                      	inc	si
 21128 0000111A E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21129                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21130                                  sum_sys_code:
 21131                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21132 0000111C BE1C11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21133                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21134                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21135                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21136                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21137                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21138                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21139                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21140 0000111F B9[6039]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21141 00001122 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21142 00001124 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21143                                  sum2:
 21144 00001126 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21145 00001129 46                      	inc	si
 21146 0000112A 46                      	inc	si
 21147 0000112B E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21148 0000112D 1F                      	pop	ds
 21149 0000112E C3                      	retn
 21150                                  
 21151                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21152                                  
 21153                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21154                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 21155 0000112F 0000                    	dw	0
 21156                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 21157                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:
 21158 00001131 0000                    	dw	0

 21160                                  mem_alloc_err_msgx:
 21161

 21172                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21173                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21174                                  ;
 21175                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21176                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21177                                  ;
 21178                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21179                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21180                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21181                                  ;
 21182                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21183                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21184                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21185                                  
 21186                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21187                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 21188                                  
 21189                                  set_buffer:
 21190 0000114E 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 21191 00001150 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 21192 00001153 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 21193 00001155 B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 21194                                  set_buff_1:
 21195                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21196                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 21197 00001157 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 21198                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 21199 00001159 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 21200                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 21201 0000115C C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 21202                                  
 21203 00001161 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 21204 00001163 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 21205 00001168 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 21206                                  
 21207                                  ;	for each buffer
 21208                                  
 21209                                  nxt_buff:
 21210 00001169 E86300                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 21211 0000116C 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 21212 0000116E E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 21213                                  
 21214 00001170 2E2B3E[9B02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 21215                                  
 21216 00001175 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 21217                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 21218 00001176 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 21219 00001179 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 21220                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 21221                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21222 0000117B 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 21223                                  
 21224 0000117F 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMa ?
 21225 00001181 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 21226                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 21227 00001183 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 21228 00001187 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 21229                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 21230 0000118B C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 21231                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 21232 00001190 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 21233 00001193 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 21234                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 21235 00001197 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 21236                                  set_buff_2:
 21237 0000119A 2E0106[DE03]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 21238                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 21239 0000119F 2E800E[3614]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 21240                                  	;call	round
 21241                                  	;retn
 21242                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21243 000011A5 E9201F                  	jmp	round
 21244                                  
 21245                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21246                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21247                                  ;
 21248                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21249                                  ;
 21250                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21251                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21252                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21253                                  
 21254                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21255                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21256 000011A8 53                      	push	bx
 21257 000011A9 52                      	push	dx
 21258 000011AA 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21259 000011AE 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21260                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21261 000011B3 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21262                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21263                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21264                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21265 000011B6 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21266 000011B8 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21267 000011BA B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21268                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21269 000011BD CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21270 000011BF 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21271 000011C2 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21272 000011C4 BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21273                                  	;zf=1
 21274                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21275                                  	;zf=1
 21276 000011C7 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21277                                  got_hma:
 21278 000011CC 5A                      	pop	dx
 21279 000011CD 5B                      	pop	bx
 21280 000011CE C3                      	retn
 21281                                  
 21282                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21283                                  
 21284                                  set_buffer_info:
 21285                                  
 21286                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 21287                                  ;
 21288                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 21289                                  ;    ax = di
 21290                                  ;
 21291                                  ;out:
 21292                                  ;    above entries set.
 21293                                  
 21294                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21295 000011CF 2EFF36[3903]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 21296                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 21297 000011D4 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 21298 000011D8 2EA3[3903]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 21299 000011DC 2E0306[9B02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 21300                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 21301 000011E1 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 21302                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 21303 000011E4 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 21304                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21305 000011EA 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 21306                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21307 000011F0 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 21308 000011F6 C3                      	retn
 21309                                  
 21310                                  ; ======================================================================
 21311                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21312                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21313                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21314                                  
 21315                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21316                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21317                                  ;
 21318                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21319                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21320                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21321                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21322                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21323                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21324                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21325                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21326                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21327                                  ;
 21328                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21329                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21330                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21331                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21332                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21333                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21334                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21335                                  ;	conditions:
 21336                                  ;
 21337                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21338                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21339                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21340                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21341                                  ;
 21342                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21343                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21344                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21345                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21346                                  ;
 21347                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21348                                  ;
 21349                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21350                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21351                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21352                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21353                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21354                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21355                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21356                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21357                                  ;
 21358                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21359                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21360                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21361                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21362                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21363                                  ;
 21364                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21365                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21366                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21367                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21368                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21369                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21370                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21371                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21372                                  ;
 21373                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21374                                  
 21375                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21376                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21377                                  
 21378                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21379                                  stackinit:
 21380 000011F7 50                      	push	ax
 21381 000011F8 1E                      	push	ds
 21382 000011F9 06                      	push	es
 21383 000011FA 53                      	push	bx
 21384 000011FB 51                      	push	cx
 21385 000011FC 52                      	push	dx
 21386 000011FD 57                      	push	di
 21387 000011FE 56                      	push	si
 21388 000011FF 55                      	push	bp
 21389                                  
 21390                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21391                                  
 21392                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21393                                  	; ds = cs
 21394 00001200 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21395 00001203 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21396                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21397                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21398                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21399 00001205 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21400                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)

 21406                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)

 21408 00001213 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21409                                  	; 12/12/2022

 21418

 21439

 21447

 21449                                  
 21450 00001246 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.

 21453                                  
 21454 0000124D 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 21455                                  
 21456                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 21457                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 21458                                  ;  cx = number of entries

 21460                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry

 21473 00001262 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]

 22210                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22211                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22212                                  
 22213                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22214                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22215                                  
 22216                                  new_init_loop:
 22217                                  
 22218                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22219                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22220                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22221                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22222                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22223                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22224                                  
 22225 000013EC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22226 000013EF 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22227 000013F1 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22228 000013F5 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22229                                  
 22230 000013F8 1E                      	push	ds
 22231                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22232                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22233                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22234 000013F9 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22235 000013FC 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22236 000013FE 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22237 00001401 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22238 00001403 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22239 00001407 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22240 0000140A 1F                      	pop	ds
 22241                                  
 22242 0000140B 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22243 0000140E 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22244 00001412 C3                      	retn
 22245                                  
 22246                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22247                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22248                                  
 22249                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22250                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22251                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22252                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22253                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22254                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22255                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22256                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22257                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22258                                  
 22259                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22260                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22261                                  
 22262                                  setdevmark:
 22263                                  
 22264 00001413 06                      	push	es
 22265 00001414 51                      	push	cx
 22266                                  
 22267 00001415 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22268 0000141A 2E890E[3414]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22269 0000141F 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22270                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22271                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22272 00001421 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22273 00001425 41                      	inc	cx
 22274                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22275 00001426 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22276                                  
 22277 0000142B 59                      	pop	cx
 22278 0000142C 07                      	pop	es
 22279 0000142D 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22280 00001432 C3                      	retn
 22281

 22480                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22481                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 22482                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 22483                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22484                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22485                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22486                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 22487                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 22488                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22489                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22490                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22491                                  
 22492                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 22493                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22494 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 22495 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 22496 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 22497                                  endstruc
 22498                                  
 22499                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 22500                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 22501                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 22502                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 22503                                  
 22504                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22505                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 22506                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 22507                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 22508                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 22509                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 22510                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 22511                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 22512                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 22513                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22514                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 22515                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22516                                  
 22517                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22518                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22519 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22520 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22521 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22522                                  endstruc
 22523                                  
 22524                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22525                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22526                                  ;
 22527                                  ;
 22528                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22529                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22530                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22531                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22532                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22533                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22534                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22535                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22536                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22537                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22538                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22539                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22540                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22541                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22542                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22543                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22544                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22545                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22546                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22547                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22548                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22549                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22550                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22551                                  ;	   :
 22552                                  ;
 22553                                  ;Note:
 22554                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22555                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22556                                  ;
 22557                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22558                                  ;
 22559                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22560                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22561                                  ;
 22562                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22563                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22564                                  ;
 22565                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22566                                  ;
 22567                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22568                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22569                                  ;
 22570                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22571                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22572                                  ;
 22573                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22574                                  ;
 22575                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22576                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22577                                  ;
 22578                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22579                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22580                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22581                                  ;
 22582                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22583                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22584                                  ;
 22585                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22586                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22587                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22588                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22589                                  
 22590                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22591                                  
 22592                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22593                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22594                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22595                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22596                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22597                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22598                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22599                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22600                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22601                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22602                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22603                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22604                                  
 22605                                  ;**** Function flags
 22606                                  
 22607                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22608                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22609                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22610                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22611                                  
 22612                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22613                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22614 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22615 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22616 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22617 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22618 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22619 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22620                                  endstruc
 22621                                  
 22622                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22623                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22624                                  ;
 22625                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22626                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22627                                  ;	     +-
 22628                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22629                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22630                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22631                                  ;	     |	:
 22632                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22633                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22634                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22635                                  ;	     |	:
 22636                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22637                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22638                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22639                                  ;	     +-	:
 22640                                  ;
 22641                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22642                                  ;
 22643                                  ;Note:
 22644                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22645                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22646                                  ;
 22647                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22648                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22649                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22650                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22651                                  
 22652                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22653                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22654                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22655                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22656                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22657                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22658                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22659                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22660                                  
 22661                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22662 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22663 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22664 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22665 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22666 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22667                                  endstruc
 22668                                  
 22669                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22670                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22671                                  ;
 22672                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22673                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22674                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22675                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22676                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22677                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22678                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22679                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22680                                  ;
 22681                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22682                                  ;
 22683                                  ;            +-
 22684                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22685                                  ;	    | or
 22686                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22687                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22688                                  ;	    | or
 22689                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22690                                  ;	    | or
 22691                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22692                                  ;	    | or
 22693                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22694                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22695                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22696                                  ;	    | or
 22697                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22698                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22699                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22700                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22701                                  ;	    +-
 22702                                  ;
 22703                                  ;
 22704                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22705                                  ;      list.
 22706                                  ;
 22707                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22708                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22709                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22710                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22711                                  
 22712                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 22713                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 22714 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 22715 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22716 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22717 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22718                                  endstruc

 22747                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 22748                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 22749                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 22833                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22834                                  ; SysParse;
 22835                                  ;
 22836                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 22837                                  ;
 22838                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 22839                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 22840                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 22841                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 22842                                  ;
 22843                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 22844                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 22845                                  ;		 is in DS.
 22846                                  ;
 22847                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 22848                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 22849                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 22850                                  ;
 22851                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 22852                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 22853                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 22854                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 22855                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 22856                                  ;
 22857                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 22858                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 22859                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 22860                                  ;
 22861                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 22862                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 22863                                  ;
 22864                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 22865                                  ;
 22866                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 22867                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 22868                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 22869                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 22870                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 22871                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 22872                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 22873                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 22874                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 22875                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 22876                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 22877                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 22878                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 22879                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 22880                                  ;	     (tm08)
 22881                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 22882                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 22883                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 22884                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 22885                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 22886                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 22887                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 22888                                  ;					  (tm12)
 22889                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 22890                                  ;					  (tm13)
 22891                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 22892                                  ;					  (tm14)
 22893                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 22894                                  ;					  (tm15)
 22895                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 22896                                  
 22897                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 22898                                  
 22899                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 22900                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 22901                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 22902                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 22903                                  
 22904                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 22905                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 22906                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 22907                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 22908                                  ;
 22909                                  
 22910                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 22911                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 22912                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 22913                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 22914                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 22915                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 22916                                  
 22917                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 22918                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 22919                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 22920                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 22921                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 22922                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 22923                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 22924                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 22925                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 22926                                  
 22927                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 22928                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 22929                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 22930                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 22931                                  ;	     segment.
 22932                                  
 22933                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 22934                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 22935                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 22936                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 22937                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 22938                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 22939

 22941                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 22942                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments

 22953                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 22954                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 22955                                  
 22956                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 22957                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as

 22959                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.

 23037                                  ;M029 -- Begin changes
 23038                                  ; The table of special chars _$P_FileSp_Char should be initialized on every
 23039                                  ;entry to SysParse. This is in the non-checksum region and any program that
 23040                                  ;corrupts this table but does not corrupt the checksum region will leave
 23041                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.
 23042                                  ; NB: The special characters string has been hardcoded here. If any change
 23043                                  ;is made to it in psdata.inc, a corresponding change needs to be made here.
 23044

 23048 00001511 2EC706[DB14]2B3E        	mov	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+4], '+>'
 23049 00001518 2EC706[DD14]3B3D        	mov 	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+6], ';='
 23050                                  ;ENDIFtHHH

 23082

 23458                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23459                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23460                                  ;
 23461                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23462                                  ;
 23463                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23464                                  ;	    AL = type
 23465                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23466                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23467                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23468                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23469                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23470                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23471                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23472                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23473                                  ;
 23474                                  ; Output:   None
 23475                                  ;
 23476                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23477                                  ;
 23478                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 23479                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23480                                  
 23481                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 23482 0000171F 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 23483 00001720 268B7F04                	mov	di,[es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Result_Buf]
 23484                                  					;AN000; di points to result buffer
 23485 00001724 2E893E[4114]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DX],di		;AC034; set returned result address
 23486 00001729 268805                  	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type],al ;AN000; store type
 23487 0000172C 26886501                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 23488 00001730 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;

 23490 00001735 26894502                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],ax 
 23491                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 23492 00001739 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23493                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;

 23522

 23526

 23528 0000176C 40                      	inc	ax			;AN000; skip left Parentheses

 23530 00001771 268C5D06                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val+2],ds ;AN000; store segment

 23532

 23566                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23567                                  ; _$P_Check_Match_Flags
 23568                                  ;
 23569                                  ; Function:  Check the mutch_flags and make the exit code and set the
 23570                                  ;	     result buffer
 23571                                  ;
 23572                                  ;	    Check for types in this order:
 23573                                  ;		Complex
 23574                                  ;		Date
 23575                                  ;		Time
 23576                                  ;		Drive
 23577                                  ;		Filespec
 23578                                  ;		Quoted String
 23579                                  ;		Simple String
 23580                                  ;
 23581                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23582                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23583                                  ;
 23584                                  ; Output:    None
 23585                                  ;
 23586                                  ; Use:	     _$P_Value, P$_SValue, _$P_Simple_String, _$P_Date_Format
 23587                                  ;	     _$P_Time_Format, _$P_Complex_Format, _$P_File_Foemat
 23588                                  ;	     _$P_Drive_Format
 23589                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23590                                  
 23591                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23592                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:19CFh)

 23681                                  ; _$P_Remove_Colon;
 23682                                  ;
 23683                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 23684                                  ;
 23685                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed
 23686                                  ;
 23687                                  ; Output:   None
 23688                                  ;
 23689                                  ; Use:	_$P_Chk_DBCS
 23690                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23691                                  
 23692                                  _$P_Remove_Colon:
 23693 00001851 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23694 00001852 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 23695                                  _$P_RCOL_Loop:				;AN000;
 23696 00001853 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 23697 00001856 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 23698 00001858 741A                    	jz	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; if yes, just exit
 23699                                  
 23700 0000185A 3C3A                    	cmp	al,_$P_Colon		;AN000; is it colon ?
 23701 0000185C 750D                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000;
 23702                                  
 23703 0000185E 2E807C0100              	cmp	byte [cs:si+1],_$P_NULL ;AN000; if so, next is NULL ?
 23704 00001863 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000; no, then next char
 23705                                  
 23706 00001865 2EC60400                	mov	byte [cs:si],_$P_NULL	;AN000; yes, remove colon
 23707 00001869 EB09                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; and exit.
 23708                                  
 23709                                  _$P_RCOL00:				;AN000;
 23710 0000186B E84404                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; if not colon, then check if
 23711 0000186E 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.
 23712                                  
 23713 00001870 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; if yes, skip trailing byte
 23714                                  _$P_RCOL01:				;AN000;
 23715 00001871 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si points to next byte
 23716 00001872 EBDF                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 23717                                  
 23718                                  _$P_RCOL_Exit:				;AN000;
 23719 00001874 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 23720 00001875 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23721 00001876 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
