 23723                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23724                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_String;
 23725                                  ;
 23726                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 23727                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 23728                                  ;
 23729                                  ; Input:    AL = 2 : Use character table
 23730                                  ;	    AL = 4 : Use file table
 23731                                  ;	    cs:SI points to string buffer to be capitalized
 23732                                  ;
 23733                                  ; Output:   None
 23734                                  ;
 23735                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23736                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23737                                  
 23738                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_String:
 23739 00001877 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 23740 00001878 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 23741 00001879 88C2                    	mov	dl,al			;AN000; save info id
 23742                                  
 23743                                  _$P_DCS_Loop:				;AN000;
 23744 0000187B 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; load charater and
 23745 0000187E E83104                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; check if DBCS leading byte
 23746 00001881 720C                    	jc	short _$P_DCS00		;AN000; if yes, do not need CAPS
 23747                                  
 23748 00001883 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 23749 00001885 740C                    	jz	short _$P_DCS_Exit	;AN000; then exit.
 23750                                  
 23751 00001887 E80C00                  	call	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char 	;AN000; Here a SBCS char need to be CAPS
 23752 0000188A 2E8804                  	mov	[cs:si],al		;AN000; stored upper case char to buffer
 23753 0000188D EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS01		;AN000; process next
 23754                                  _$P_DCS00:				;AN000;
 23755 0000188F 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip DBCS leading and trailing byte
 23756                                  _$P_DCS01:				;AN000;
 23757 00001890 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si point to next byte

 23759                                  _$P_DCS_Exit:				;AN000;
 23760 00001893 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 23761 00001894 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 23762 00001895 C3                      	retn

 23764                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23765                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_Char;
 23766                                  ;
 23767                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 23768                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 23769                                  ;
 23770                                  ; Input:    DL = 2 : Use character table
 23771                                  ;	    DL = 4 : Use file table
 23772                                  ;	    AL = character to be capitalized
 23773                                  ;
 23774                                  ; Output:   None
 23775                                  ;
 23776                                  ; Use:	INT 21h /w AH=65h
 23777                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23778                                  
 23779                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_Char:
 23780 00001896 3C80                    	cmp	al,_$P_ASCII80	;80h	;AN000; need upper case table ?
 23781 00001898 730C                    	jae	short _$P_DCC_Go	;AN000;
 23782                                  
 23783 0000189A 3C61                    	cmp	al,"a"                  ;AN000; if no,
 23784 0000189C 723C                    	jb	short _$P_CAPS_Ret	;AN000;   check if  "a" <= AL <= "z"
 23785                                  
 23786 0000189E 3C7A                    	cmp	al,"z"                  ;AN000;
 23787 000018A0 7738                    	ja	short _$P_CAPS_Ret	;AN000;   if yes, make CAPS
 23788                                  
 23789 000018A2 24DF                    	and	al,_$P_Make_Upper ;0DFh ;AN000;   else do nothing.
 23790 000018A4 EB34                    	jmp	short _$P_CAPS_Ret	;AN000;
 23791                                  
 23792                                  _$P_DCC_Go:				;AN000;
 23793 000018A6 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 23794 000018A7 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 23795 000018A8 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 23796

 23798 000018A9 8D3E[D214]              	lea	di,[_$P_Char_CAP_Ptr]
 23799                                  _$P_DCC00:				;AN000;
 23800 000018AD 2E3815                  	cmp	[cs:di],dl		;AN000; already got table address ?
 23801 000018B0 7417                    	je	short _$P_DCC01		;AN000; if no,
 23802                                  
 23803                                  ;In this next section, ES will be used to pass a 5 byte workarea to INT 21h,
 23804                                  ; the GET COUNTYRY INFO call. This usage of ES is required by the function
 23805                                  ; call, regardless of what base register is currently be defined as cs.
 23806                                  
 23807 000018B2 50                      	push	ax			;AN000; get CAPS table thru DOS call
 23808 000018B3 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 23809 000018B4 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 23810                                  
 23811 000018B5 0E                      	push	cs			;AC036; pass current base seg into
 23812                                  					;(Note: this used to push CS.  BUG...
 23813 000018B6 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;   ES reg, required for

 23848                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23849                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 23850                                  ;
 23851                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 23852                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 23853                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 23854                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 23855                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 23856                                  ;
 23857                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23858                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23859                                  ;
 23860                                  ; Output:    None
 23861                                  ;
 23862                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 23863                                  ;
 23864                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 23865                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23866                                  
 23867                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23868                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 23869                                  
 23870                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 23871 000018DB 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23872 000018DC 2E800E[4914]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 23873 000018E2 2E8026[4914]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 23874 000018E8 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 23875 000018EB 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 23876 000018ED 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 23877                                  
 23878 000018EF 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?

 23880

 23885 000018FA E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 23886 000018FD 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23887 000018FE C3                      	retn

 24082                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24083                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 24084                                  ;
 24085                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 24086                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 24087                                  ;
 24088                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 24089                                  ;
 24090                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 24091                                  ;
 24092                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24093                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24094                                  
 24095                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24096                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 24097 000019F0 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 24098 000019F1 2EF606[4914]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 24099 000019F7 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 24100                                  
 24101 000019F9 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24102 000019FA C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24103                                  
 24104                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24105 000019FB 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24106 000019FC 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24107                                  
 24108 000019FE F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24109 000019FF C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24110                                  
 24111                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 24112 00001A00 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24113 00001A01 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24114

 24565 00001BBB 7517                    	jne	short _$P_Drv_Err	;AN000;
 24566                                  
 24567                                  _$P_DrvF00:				;AN000;
 24568 00001BBD 0C20                    	or	al,_$P_Make_Lower	;AN000; lower case
 24569 00001BBF 3C61                    	cmp	al,"a"                  ;AN000; drive letter must
 24570 00001BC1 7211                    	jb	short _$P_Drv_Err	;AN000; in range of
 24571                                  
 24572 00001BC3 3C7A                    	cmp	al,"z"                  ;AN000; "a" - "z"
 24573 00001BC5 770D                    	ja	short _$P_Drv_Err	;AN000; if no, error
 24574                                  
 24575 00001BC7 2C60                    	sub	al,"a"-1                ;AN000; make text drive to binary drive
 24576 00001BC9 88C2                    	mov	dl,al			;AN000; set
 24577 00001BCB B4FF                    	mov	ah,_$P_No_Tag		;AN000;    result
 24578 00001BCD B006                    	mov	al,_$P_Drive		;AN000; 	 buffer
 24579 00001BCF E84DFB                  	call	_$P_Fill_Result		;AN000; 	       to drive
 24580 00001BD2 EB07                    	jmp	short _$P_Drv_Exit	;AN000;
 24581                                  
 24582                                  _$P_Drv_Err:				;AN000;
 24583 00001BD4 2EC706[3D14]0900        	mov	word [cs:_$P_RC],_$P_Syntax ;AC034;
 24584                                  _$P_Drv_Exit:				;AN000;
 24585 00001BDB 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 24586 00001BDC 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24587 00001BDD C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 24589                                  ;ENDIF					;AN000;(of DrvSW)

 24591                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24592                                  ; _$P_Skip_Delim;
 24593                                  ;
 24594                                  ; Function: Skip delimiters specified in the PARMS list, white space
 24595                                  ;	    and comma.
 24596                                  ;
 24597                                  ; Input:    DS:SI -> Command String
 24598                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 24599                                  ;
 24600                                  ; Output:   CY = 1 if the end of line encounterd
 24601                                  ;	    CY = 0 then SI move to 1st non-delimiter character
 24602                                  ;	    AL = Last examineed character
 24603                                  ;
 24604                                  ; Use:	    _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim,
 24605                                  ;
 24606                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24607                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24608                                  
 24609                                  _$P_Skip_Delim:
 24610                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 24611 00001BDE AC                      	lodsb				;AN000;
 24612 00001BDF E81F00                  	call	_$P_Chk_EOL		;AN000; is it EOL character ?
 24613 00001BE2 7417                    	jz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_CY	;AN000; if yes, exit w/ CY on
 24614                                  
 24615 00001BE4 E85000                  	call	_$P_Chk_Delim		;AN000; is it one of delimiters ?
 24616 00001BE7 7515                    	jnz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_NCY ;AN000; if no, exit w/ CY off
 24617                                  
 24618 00001BE9 2EF606[4914]20          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra ;AC034; extra delim or comma found ?
 24619 00001BEF 74ED                    	jz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Loop ;AN000; if no, loop
 24620                                  
 24621 00001BF1 2EF606[4914]41          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW+_$P_equ ;AC034; /x , or xxx=zzz , (tm08)
 24622 00001BF7 7407                    	jz	short _$P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; no switch, no keyword (tm08)
 24623                                  
 24624                                  	;dec	si			;AN000; backup si for next call (tm08)
 24625                                  	;jmp	short _$P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; else exit w/ CY off
 24626                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24627                                  	; cf=0
 24628 00001BF9 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit
 24629                                  
 24630                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_CY:			;AN000;
 24631 00001BFB F9                      	stc				;AN000; indicate EOL
 24632 00001BFC EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24633                                  
 24634                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_NCY:			;AN000;
 24635 00001BFE F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate non delim
 24636                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit:			;AN000; in this case, need
 24637 00001BFF 4E                      	dec	si			;AN000;  backup index pointer
 24638                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24639                                  _$P_Exit_At_Extra:	 ; cf=0
 24640 00001C00 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24641                                  
 24642                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24643                                  ;_$P_Exit_At_Extra:			;AN000;
 24644                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate extra delim
 24645                                  	;retn				;AN000;
 24646                                  
 24647                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24648                                  ; _$P_Chk_EOL;
 24649                                  ;
 24650                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of End of Line characters.
 24651                                  ;
 24652                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24653                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 24654                                  ;
 24655                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of End of Line characters
 24656                                  ;**********************************************************************
 24657                                  
 24658                                  _$P_Chk_EOL:
 24659 00001C01 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 24660 00001C02 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24661 00001C03 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; Carriage return ?
 24662 00001C05 742D                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24663                                  
 24664 00001C07 3C00                    	cmp	al,_$P_NULL		;AN000; zero ?
 24665 00001C09 7429                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24666                                  
 24667                                  ;IF LFEOLSW				;AN028; IF LF TO BE ACCEPTED AS EOL
 24668 00001C0B 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?
 24669 00001C0D 7425                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24670                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;
 24671                                  
 24672 00001C0F 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 24673                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 24674 00001C14 721E                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24675                                  
 24676 00001C16 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 24677 00001C18 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 24678                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24679 00001C1C 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 24680 00001C1F 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 24681 00001C23 740D                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 24682                                  
 24683                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 24684 00001C25 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24685 00001C27 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000;
 24686                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 24687 00001C2A 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 24688 00001C2B 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 24689 00001C2E 7404                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24690                                  
 24691 00001C30 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 24692                                  
 24693                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 24694 00001C32 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 24695                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 24696 00001C34 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24697 00001C35 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24698 00001C36 C3                      	retn
 24699                                  
 24700                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24701                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 24702                                  ;
 24703                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 24704                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 24705                                  ;	    blanks.
 24706                                  ;
 24707                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24708                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 24709                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 24710                                  ;
 24711                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 24712                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 24713                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 24714                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24715                                  
 24716                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 24717 00001C37 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 24718 00001C38 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24719 00001C39 2EC606[4314]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 24720                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 24721                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 24722 00001C3F 2E8026[4914]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 24723 00001C45 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 24724 00001C47 7436                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24725                                  
 24726 00001C49 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 24727 00001C4B 7432                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24728                                  
 24729 00001C4D 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 24730 00001C4F 7431                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 24731                                  
 24732                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 24733                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 24734 00001C51 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 24735 00001C53 750C                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 24736                                  
 24737 00001C55 803C20                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 24738 00001C58 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 24739                                  
 24740 00001C5A B020                    	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 24741 00001C5C 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 24742 00001C5D 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 24743 00001C5F EB1E                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24744                                  
 24745                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 24746 00001C61 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 24747                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 24748 00001C66 7217                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24749                                  
 24750                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 24751 00001C68 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24752                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 24753 00001C6A 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 24754                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24755 00001C6E 09C9                    	or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 24756 00001C70 740B                    	jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 24757                                  
 24758 00001C72 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 24759                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 24760 00001C75 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 24761 00001C76 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 24762 00001C79 7407                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 24763                                  
 24764 00001C7B E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 24765                                  
 24766                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 24767 00001C7D 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 24768                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 24769                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 24770 00001C7F 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24771 00001C80 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24772 00001C81 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24773                                  
 24774                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 24775 00001C82 2EA2[4314]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 24776 00001C86 2EF606[4914]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 24777 00001C8C 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 24778                                  
 24779 00001C8E 2E800E[4914]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 24780                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 24781                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 24782 00001C94 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 24783 00001C96 EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;

 24786                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24787                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 24788                                  ;
 24789                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 24790                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 24791                                  ;
 24792                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24793                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 24794                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 24795                                  ;
 24796                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 24797                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 24798                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 24799                                  
 24800                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 24801                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 24802                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 24803                                  ;
 24804                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 24805                                  
 24806                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 24807                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24808                                  
 24809                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 24810                                  	;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 24811 00001C98 8D2E[5214]              	lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	; BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 24812                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 24813 00001C9C 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 24814 00001C9E 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 24815                                  
 24816                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 24817 00001CA0 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24818 00001CA2 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 24819                                  
 24820 00001CA4 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 24821                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24822                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24823 00001CA5 C3                      	retn
 24824                                  
 24825                                  ; 12/12/2022
 24826                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 24827                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 24828                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24829                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 24830                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24831                                  
 24832                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 24833                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 24834 00001CA6 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24835 00001CA8 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 24836                                  
 24837 00001CAA 2E800E[4914]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 24838                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24839                                  
 24840                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24841                                  	; cf=0
 24842                                  	;retn
 24843                                  
 24844                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 24845                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24846                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 24847 00001CB0 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 24848                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 24849                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 24850 00001CB1 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24851                                  
 24852                                  ;**************************************************************************
 24853                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24854                                  ;
 24855                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 24856                                  ;
 24857                                  ;  Input:
 24858                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 24859                                  ;
 24860                                  ;  Output:
 24861                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 24862                                  ;
 24863                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 24864                                  ;
 24865                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 24866                                  ;***************************************************************************
 24867                                  
 24868                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24869 00001CB2 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 24870 00001CB3 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24871 00001CB4 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24872                                  	
 24873 00001CB5 2E833E[4614]00          	cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 24874 00001CBB 7527                    	jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 24875                                  
 24876 00001CBD 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24877 00001CBE 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24878 00001CBF 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24879 00001CC0 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24880 00001CC1 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24881 00001CC2 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 24882 00001CC3 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 24883 00001CC4 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 24884 00001CC6 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 24885 00001CC8 B80063                  	MOV	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 24886 00001CCB CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 24887                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 24888 00001CCD 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24889 00001CCF 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24890 00001CD1 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 24891 00001CD2 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 24892 00001CD3 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 24893 00001CD4 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 24894 00001CD5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24895 00001CD6 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24896 00001CD7 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24897 00001CD8 7429                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 24898                                  
 24899                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 24900 00001CDA 2E8936[4414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 24901 00001CDF 2E891E[4614]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 24902                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 24903 00001CE4 2E8B36[4414]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 24904 00001CE9 2E8E1E[4614]            	mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 24905                                  
 24906                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 24907 00001CEE 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 24908 00001CF1 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 24909                                  
 24910 00001CF3 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 24911 00001CF5 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 24912                                  
 24913 00001CF7 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 24914 00001CFA 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 24915                                  
 24916 00001CFC F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 24917 00001CFD EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 24918                                  
 24919                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 24920 00001CFF 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 24921 00001D00 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 24922                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 24923 00001D01 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 24924                                  
 24925                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 24926                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24927                                  	; cf=0
 24928                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 24929                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 24930 00001D03 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24931 00001D04 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 24932 00001D05 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 24933 00001D06 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 24946 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?
 24947 00000002 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; an extra delimiter list
 24948 00000003 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; length is 1
 24949 00000004 ??                      	resb 	1	; db ';' ; delimiter
 24950                                  .size:
 24951                                  endstruc
 24952                                  
 24953                                  struc p_pos
 24954 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; numeric value??
 24955 00000002 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; function
 24956 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer
 24957                                  
 24958                                  ; note: by defining result_val before this structure, we could remove
 24959                                  ;  the "result_val" from every structure invocation
 24960                                  
 24961 00000006 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; value list
 24962 00000008 ??                      	resb	1	; db 0	; no switches/keywords
 24963                                  .size:
 24964                                  endstruc
 24965                                  
 24966                                  struc	p_range
 24967 00000000 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; range definition
 24968 00000001 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; 1 definition of range

 24970 00000003 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric min

 25489                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 25491                                  
 25492                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25493                                  ;
 25494                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25495                                  ;
 25496                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25497                                  ;
 25498                                  ;   Modification log:
 25499                                  ;
 25500                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25501                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25502                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25503                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25504                                  ;
 25505                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25506                                  ;
 25507                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25508                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25509                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25510                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25511                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25512                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25513                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25514                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25515                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25516                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25517                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25518                                  ;
 25519                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25520                                  
 25521                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25522                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25523                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25524                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25525                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25526                                  
 25527                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25528                                  
 25529                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25530                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25531                                  
 25532                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25533                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25534                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25535                                  
 25536                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25537                                  ;
 25538                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25539                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25540                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25541                                  ;	           line.
 25542                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25543                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25544                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25545                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25546                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25547                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25548                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25549                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25550                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25551                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25552                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25553                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25554                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25555                                  ;	           for details).
 25556                                  
 25557                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25558                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25559                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25560                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25561                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25562                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25563                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25564                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25565                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25566                                  
 25567                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25568                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25569                                  
 25570                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25571                                  
 25572                                  %endif

 25695                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear

 25794                                  multi_pass:
 25795 00001FB0 0E                      	push	cs
 25796 00001FB1 1F                      	pop	ds
 25797                                  
 25798 00001FB2 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 25799                                  ;jae_endconv:
 25800 00001FB7 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 25801                                  
 25802                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 25803                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25804 00001FB9 FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 25805 00001FBD 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 25806                                  
 25807 00001FBE 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 25808 00001FC2 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 25809 00001FC6 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 25810 00001FC8 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 25811 00001FCC 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 25812                                  
 25813 00001FD0 E86807                  	call	getchr
 25814 00001FD3 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 25815                                  
 25816                                  getcom:
 25817 00001FD5 E8B10E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 25818 00001FD8 E86007                  	call	getchr
 25819                                  conflp: 
 25820 00001FDB 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 25821                                  
 25822 00001FDD FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 25823                                  
 25824 00001FE1 C606[3314]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 25825 00001FE6 C606[3614]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 25826 00001FEB 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 25827 00001FED 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 25828                                  
 25829                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25830                                  %if 0
 25831                                  
 25832                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25833                                  
 25834                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 25835                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 25836                                  
 25837                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 25838                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 25839                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 25840                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 25841                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 25842                                  
 25843                                          push    ax                      ;
 25844                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 25845                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 25846                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 25847                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 25848                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 25849                                          pop     ax
 25850                                  ;
 25851                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 25852                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 25853                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 25854                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 25855                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 25856                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 25857                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 25858                                  ;   spot.
 25859                                  ;
 25860                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 25861                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 25862                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 25863                                  ;   retrieved.
 25864                                  ;
 25865                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 25866                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25867                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25868                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25869                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 25870                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 25871                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25872                                  final:                                  ;
 25873                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 25874                                  not_final:                              ;
 25875                                  ;endif
 25876                                  
 25877                                  %endif
 25878 00001FEF 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 25879 00001FF1 E84707                  	call	getchr
 25880 00001FF4 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 25881                                  
 25882 00001FF6 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 25883                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 25884                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25885 00001FFB 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 25886 00001FFD E90707                  	jmp	badop
 25887

 25891                                  	;push	cs
 25892                                  	;pop	ds

 25900                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25901                                  ; 11/12/2022
 25902                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 25903                                  ;coff_p:
 25904                                  	;push	cs
 25905                                  	;pop	ds
 25906                                  
 25907                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 25908                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 25909                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 25910                                  ;install= command.
 25911

 25913                                  ;install command
 25914                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25915                                  
 25916                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25917                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 25918                                  tryi:
 25919 0000200A 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 25920 0000200F 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 25921 00002011 E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 25922                                  not_init_pass:
 25923 00002014 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 25924                                          ; 11/12/2022
 25925                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs

 26045                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26046                                  ;									      *
 26047                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26048                                  ;									      *
 26049                                  ; input :								      *
 26050                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26051                                  ; output:								      *
 26052                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26053                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26054                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26055                                  ;									      *
 26056                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26057                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *

 26059                                  ; {									      *
 26060                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *

 26070                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26071                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26072                                  ;	};								      *
 26073                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26074                                  ; };									      *
 26075                                  ;									      *

 27592                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27593                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27594                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27595                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27596                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27597                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27598                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27599                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27600                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27601                                  
 27602                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27603                                  ;									  *
 27604                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27605                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27606                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27607                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27608                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27609                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27610                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27611                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27612                                  ; input :								  *
 27613                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27614                                  ; output:								  *
 27615                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27616                                  ;									  *
 27617                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27618                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27619                                  ; logic:								  *
 27620                                  ; {									  *
 27621                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27622                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27623                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27624                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27625                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 27626                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 27627                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27628                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 27629                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27630                                  ;	     }								  *
 27631                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 27632                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 27633                                  ;	};								  *
 27634                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 27635                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 27636                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 27637                                  ; };									  *
 27638                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27639

 28305                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28306                                  
 28307                                  sysinit_parse:
 28308                                  
 28309                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28310                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28311                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28312                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28313                                  ;
 28314                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28315                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28316                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28317                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28318                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28319                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28320                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28321                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28322                                  ;	 procedure.
 28323                                  ;	ax - exit code
 28324                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 28325                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 28326                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 28327                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 28328                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28329                                  
 28330                                  	; 24/10/2022
 28331 000026E4 06                      	push	es			;save es,ds
 28332 000026E5 1E                      	push	ds
 28333                                  
 28334 000026E6 06                      	push	es
 28335 000026E7 1F                      	pop	ds			;now ds:si -> command line
 28336                                  
 28337 000026E8 0E                      	push	cs
 28338 000026E9 07                      	pop	es			;now es:di -> control definition
 28339                                  
 28340 000026EA 2E8C1E[3914]            	mov	[cs:badparm_seg],ds	;save the pointer to the parm
 28341 000026EF 2E8936[3714]            	mov	[cs:badparm_off],si	;we are about to parse for badparm msg.
 28342                                  	;mov	dx,0

 28653                                  ;
 28654                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 28655                                  ;
 28656                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 28657                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 28658                                  ;
 28659                                  ;	Output : none
 28660                                  ;
 28661                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 28662                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 28663                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28664                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 28665                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28666                                  ;
 28667                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28668                                  
 28669                                  LieInt12Mem:
 28670                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28671                                  	; ds = cs
 28672 000027A4 A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]

 28674                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 28675 000027A7 E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 28676 000027AA 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 28677                                  	; 13/05/2019
 28678                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 28679                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 28680                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 28681                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28682                                  	; ds = cs
 28683 000027AC 803E[071F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 28684 000027B1 74F0                    	je	short limx
 28685 000027B3 A1[EE1E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 28686                                  lim_set:
 28687                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28688                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28689                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 28690                                  ;limx:
 28691                                  	;retn
 28692                                  	
 28693                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 28694                                  
 28695                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28696                                  ;
 28697                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 28698                                  ;
 28699                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 28700                                  ;	Output : none
 28701                                  ;
 28702                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 28703                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 28704                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 28705                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 28706                                  ;
 28707                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28708                                  
 28709                                  	; 01/11/2022
 28710                                  SetInt12Mem:
 28711 000027B6 1E                      	push	ds
 28712 000027B7 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 28713 000027BA 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 28714 000027BC 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 28715 000027C0 2E891E[0B1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 28716 000027C5 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 28717 000027C7 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 28718 000027C9 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 28719 000027CC 2EC606[0A1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 28720 000027D2 1F                      	pop	ds
 28721                                  ;limx:
 28722 000027D3 C3                      	retn
 28723                                  
 28724                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28725                                  ;
 28726                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 28727                                  ;
 28728                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 28729                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 28730                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 28731                                  ;
 28732                                  ;	Output : none
 28733                                  ;
 28734                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 28735                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 28736                                  ;
 28737                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28738                                  
 28739                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 28740                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28741                                  	; ds = cs
 28742 000027D4 803E[0A1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28743                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 28744                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 28745                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 28746 000027D9 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 28747                                  	; 18/12/2022
 28748 000027DB B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 28749 000027DE 8826[0A1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 28750                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28751                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 28752 000027E2 1E                      	push	ds
 28753                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 28754 000027E3 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 28755 000027E5 2EA1[0B1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 28756 000027E9 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 28757 000027EC 1F                      	pop	ds
 28758                                  timx:
 28759 000027ED C3                      	retn
 28760

 28812                                  
 28813                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 28814                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 28815                                  
 28816                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28817                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 28818                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28819                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28820                                  
 28821                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28822                                  ;
 28823                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 28824                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 28825                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 28826                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 28827                                  ;
 28828                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 28829                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 28830                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 28831                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 28832                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 28833                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 28834                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 28835                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 28836                                  ; available during the load.
 28837                                  ;
 28838                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 28839                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 28840                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 28841                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 28842                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 28843                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 28844                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 28845                                  ;
 28846                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 28847                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 28848                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 28849                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 28850                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 28851                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 28852                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 28853                                  ;
 28854                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28855                                  
 28856                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 28857                                  
 28858                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 28859                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 28860                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 28861                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 28862                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 28863                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 28864                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 28865                                  
 28866                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 28867                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 28868                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 28869                                  
 28870                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28871                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 28872                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28873                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 28874                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 28875                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 28876                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 28877                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28878                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 28879                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 28880                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28881                                  
 28882                                  InitVar:
 28883                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 28884                                  	push	ax
 28885                                  	push	cx
 28886                                  	push	di
 28887                                  	push	es
 28888                                  
 28889                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 28890                                  	push	cs
 28891                                  	pop	es
 28892                                  
 28893                                  	xor	ax,ax
 28894                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 28895                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 28896                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 28897                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 28898                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 28899                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 28900                                  
 28901                                  	cld
 28902                                  
 28903                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 28904                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 28905                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 28906                                  
 28907                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 28908                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 28909                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 28910                                  
 28911                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 28912                                  
 28913                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 28914                                  	pop	es
 28915                                  	pop	di
 28916                                  	pop	cx
 28917                                  	pop	ax	 	
 28918                                  
 28919                                  	retn
 28920                                  
 28921                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28922                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 28923                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28924                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 28925                                  ; EXIT    : None
 28926                                  ; ERROR   : None
 28927                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 28928                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28929                                  
 28930                                  FixMem:
 28931                                  	push	ax
 28932                                  	push	bx
 28933                                  	push	cx
 28934                                  	push	dx
 28935                                  	push	es
 28936                                  
 28937                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 28938                                  
 28939                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 28940                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 28941
