 32886                                  ;
 32887                                  ; procedure : setdeviceparameters
 32888                                  ;
 32889                                  ; setdeviceparameters sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the
 32890                                  ; system based on the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the
 32891                                  ; various form factors are present in the bpbtable. for hard files,
 32892                                  ; the recommended bpb is the same as the bpb on the drive.
 32893                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
 32894                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
 32895                                  ;
 32896                                  ;	if we return carry, the DRIVPARM will be aborted, but presently
 32897                                  ;	  we always return no carry
 32898                                  ;
 32899                                  ;	note:  there is a routine by the same name in msdioctl.asm
 32900                                  ;
 32901                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32902                                  
 32903                                  ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32904                                  
 32905                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32906                                  setdeviceparameters:
 32907                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32908                                  	; ds = cs
 32909                                  	
 32910 00002DE9 06                      	push	es
 32911                                  
 32912 00002DEA 0E                      	push	cs
 32913 00002DEB 07                      	pop	es
 32914                                  
 32915 00002DEC 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 32916 00002DEE 8A1E[E735]              	mov	bl,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE]
 32917 00002DF2 80FB00                  	cmp	bl,DEV_5INCH ; 0
 32918 00002DF5 7506                    	jne	short got_80
 32919                                  
 32920 00002DF7 C706[EA35]2800          	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 32921                                  							; 48 tpi=40 cyl
 32922                                  got_80:
 32923 00002DFD D1E3                    	shl	bx,1			; get index into bpb table
 32924 00002DFF 8BB7[8E37]              	mov	si,[bpbtable+bx]	; get address of bpb
 32925                                  
 32926                                  	;mov	di,deviceparameters+7	
 32927                                  	; 02/11/2022
 32928 00002E03 BF[ED35]                	mov	di,deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB ; es:di -> bpb
 32929 00002E06 B91F00                  	mov	cx,A_BPB.size ; 31
 32930 00002E09 FC                      	cld
 32931                                  	;repe	movsb
 32932                                  	; 02/11/2022
 32933 00002E0A F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 32934                                  
 32935 00002E0C 07                      	pop	es
 32936                                  
 32937                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32938 00002E0D F606[0F37]20            	test	byte [switches],flagseclim ; 20h
 32939                                  	;test	word [switches],flagseclim ; 20h
 32940 00002E12 7406                    	jz	short see_heads
 32941                                  
 32942 00002E14 A1[0C37]                	mov	ax,[slim]
 32943                                  	;mov	[deviceparameters+20],ax
 32944 00002E17 A3[FA35]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],ax
 32945                                  
 32946                                  see_heads:
 32947                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32948 00002E1A F606[0F37]40            	test	byte [switches],flagheads ; 40h
 32949                                  	;test	word [switches],flagheads ; 40h
 32950 00002E1F 7406                    	jz	short heads_not_altered
 32951                                  
 32952 00002E21 A1[0A37]                	mov	ax,[hlim]
 32953                                  	;mov	[deviceparameters+22],ax	
 32954 00002E24 A3[FC35]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],ax
 32955                                  
 32956                                  heads_not_altered:
 32957                                  
 32958                                  ; set up correct media descriptor byte and sectors/cluster
 32959                                  ;   sectors/cluster is always 2 except for any one sided disk or 1.44M
 32960                                  
 32961                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+9],2
 32962                                  	; 02/11/2022
 32963                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],2
 32964                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32965 00002E27 B80200                  	mov	ax,2	
 32966 00002E2A A2[EF35]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 2
 32967                                  
 32968 00002E2D B3F0                    	mov	bl,0F0h			; get default mediabyte
 32969                                  
 32970                                  ;	preload the mediadescriptor from the bpb into bh for convenient access
 32971                                  
 32972                                  	;mov	bh,[deviceparameters+17]
 32973                                  	; 02/11/2022
 32974 00002E2F 8A3E[F735]              	mov	bh,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 32975                                  
 32976                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32977                                  	; ax = 2
 32978 00002E33 3906[FC35]              	cmp	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],ax ; >2 heads?
 32979                                  	;cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],2 ; >2 heads?
 32980 00002E37 773C                    	ja	short got_correct_mediad ; just use default if heads>2
 32981                                  
 32982 00002E39 7524                    	jne	short only_one_head	; one head, do one head stuff
 32983                                  
 32984                                  ;	two head drives will use the mediadescriptor from the bpb
 32985                                  
 32986 00002E3B 88FB                    	mov	bl,bh			; get mediadescriptor from bpb
 32987                                  
 32988                                  ;	two sided drives have two special cases to look for. One is
 32989                                  ;	   a 320K diskette (40 tracks, 8 secs per track). It uses
 32990                                  ;	   a mediaid of 0fch. The other is 1.44M, which uses only
 32991                                  ;	   one sector/cluster.
 32992                                  
 32993                                  ;	any drive with 18secs/trk, 2 heads, 80 tracks, will be assumed
 32994                                  ;	   to be a 1.44M and use only 1 sector per cluster. Any other
 32995                                  ;	   type of 2 headed drive is all set.
 32996                                  
 32997 00002E3D 833E[FA35]12            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],18
 32998 00002E42 7509                    	jne	short not_144m
 32999 00002E44 833E[EA35]50            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],80
 33000 00002E49 7502                    	jne	short not_144m
 33001                                  
 33002                                  ;	We've got cyl=80, heads=2, secpertrack=18. Set cluster size to 1.
 33003                                  
 33004 00002E4B EB24                    	jmp	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 33005                                  
 33006                                  ;	check for 320K
 33007                                  
 33008                                  not_144m:
 33009 00002E4D 833E[EA35]28            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 33010 00002E52 7521                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 33011 00002E54 833E[FA35]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 33012 00002E59 751A                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 33013                                  
 33014 00002E5B B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh
 33015 00002E5D EB16                    	jmp	short got_correct_mediad
 33016                                  
 33017                                  only_one_head:
 33018                                  
 33019                                  ;	if we don't have a 360K drive, then just go use 0f0h as media descr.
 33020                                  
 33021 00002E5F 803E[E735]00            	cmp	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],DEV_5INCH ; 0
 33022 00002E64 740B                    	je	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 33023                                  
 33024                                  ;	single sided 360K drive uses either 0fch or 0feh, depending on
 33025                                  ;	  whether sectorspertrack is 8 or 9. For our purposes, anything
 33026                                  ;	  besides 8 will be considered 0fch
 33027                                  
 33028 00002E66 B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh			; single sided 9 sector media id
 33029 00002E68 833E[FA35]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 33030                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33031 00002E6D 7502                    	jne	short got_one_secperclus_drive ; okay if anything besides 8
 33032                                  
 33033 00002E6F B3FE                    	mov	bl,0FEh			; 160K mediaid
 33034                                  
 33035                                  ;	we've either got a one sided drive, or a 1.44M drive
 33036                                  ;	  either case we'll use 1 sector per cluster instead of 2
 33037                                  
 33038                                  got_one_secperclus_drive:
 33039                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33040                                  	; ax = 2
 33041 00002E71 48                      	dec	ax  ; ax = 1
 33042 00002E72 A2[EF35]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 1
 33043                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],1
 33044                                  
 33045                                  got_correct_mediad:
 33046 00002E75 881E[F735]              	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR],bl
 33047                                  
 33048                                  ;	 Calculate the correct number of Total Sectors on medium
 33049                                  
 33050 00002E79 A1[EA35]                	mov	ax,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS]
 33051 00002E7C F726[FC35]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS]
 33052 00002E80 F726[FA35]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK]
 33053 00002E84 A3[F535]                	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS],ax
 33054 00002E87 F8                      	clc				; we currently return no errors
 33055                                  
 33056 00002E88 C3                      	retn
 33057                                  
 33058                                  ;	M047 -- end rewritten routine

 33076                                  ;ifndef	MULTI_CONFIG
 33077                                  ;
 33078                                  ;;   In MULTI_CONFIG, we map to upper case on a line-by-line basis,
 33079                                  ;;   because we the case of values in SET commands preserved
 33080                                  ;

 33529                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33530                                  ;
 33531                                  ; procedure : skip_comment
 33532                                  ;
 33533                                  ;skip the commented string until lf, if current es:si-> a comment string.
 33534                                  ;in) es:si-> string
 33535                                  ;	 cx -> length.
 33536                                  ;out) zero flag not set if not found a comment string.
 33537                                  ;	  zero flag set if found a comment string and skipped it. al will contain
 33538                                  ;	  the line feed character at this moment when return.
 33539                                  ;	  ax register destroyed.
 33540                                  ;	  if found, si, cx register adjusted accordingly.
 33541                                  ;
 33542                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33543                                  
 33544                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33545                                  
 33546                                  skip_comment:
 33547 0000304F E3EE                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of the organize routine.
 33548                                  
 33549                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33550                                  	; ds = cs	
 33551                                  
 33552 00003051 803E[CC03]00            	cmp	byte [com_level],0
 33553                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:com_level],0 ; only check it if parameter level is 0.
 33554 00003056 752C                    	jne	short no_commt	 ; (not inside quotations)
 33555                                  
 33556 00003058 803E[CD03]01            	cmp	byte [cmmt],1
 33557                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],1
 33558 0000305D 7225                    	jb	short no_commt
 33559                                  
 33560 0000305F 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 33561                                  	
 33562 00003062 3806[CE03]              	cmp	[cmmt1],al
 33563                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt1],al
 33564 00003066 751C                    	jne	short no_commt
 33565                                  
 33566 00003068 803E[CD03]02            	cmp	byte [cmmt],2
 33567                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],2
 33568 0000306D 750A                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 33569                                  
 33570 0000306F 268A4401                	mov	al,[es:si+1]
 33571                                  	
 33572 00003073 3806[CF03]              	cmp	[cmmt2],al
 33573                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt2],al
 33574 00003077 750B                    	jne	short no_commt
 33575                                  skip_cmmt:
 33576 00003079 E3C4                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of organize routine.
 33577 0000307B 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 33578 0000307E 46                      	inc	si
 33579 0000307F 49                      	dec	cx
 33580 00003080 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf		; line feed?
 33581 00003082 75F5                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 33582                                  no_commt:
 33583 00003084 C3                      	retn
 33584                                  
 33585                                  ; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33586                                  %if 0
 33587                                  
 33588                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 33589                                  
 33590                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33591                                  ;
 33592                                  ;   kbd_read: wait for keystroke
 33593                                  ;
 33594                                  ;   INPUT
 33595                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 33596                                  ;
 33597                                  ;   OUTPUT
 33598                                  ;       Carry SET to clean boot, CLEAR otherwise
 33599                                  ;
 33600                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 33601                                  ;       All
 33602                                  ;
 33603                                  ;   HISTORY
 33604                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 33605                                  ;
 33606                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33607                                  
 33608                                  kbd_read:
 33609                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],2
 33610                                          jnz     short kbd_nodelay
 33611                                  
 33612                                          push    ds              ; the bios timer tick count is incremented
 33613                                          sub     ax,ax           ; 18.2 times per second;
 33614                                          mov     ds,ax           ; watch the timer tick count for 37 transitions
 33615                                  	;mov	dx,[046Ch]	; get initial value
 33616                                  kbd_loop:
 33617                                          mov     ah,1            ;
 33618                                          int     16h             ; peek the keyboard
 33619                                          jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; something's there, get out
 33620                                          mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 33621                                          int     16h             ;
 33622                                          test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 33623                                          jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; yes
 33624                                          mov     ax,[046Ch]	;
 33625                                  	;sub	ax,dx           ; get difference
 33626                                  	; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33627                                  	sub	ax,[cs:_timer_lw_] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:42E5h        
 33628                                  
 33629                                  	cmp     al,37           ; reached limit?
 33630                                          jb	short kbd_loop	; not yet
 33631                                  kbd_loopdone:
 33632                                          pop     ds              ; delay complete!
 33633                                  kbd_nodelay:
 33634                                          sub     bx,bx           ; assume clean boot
 33635                                          mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 33636                                          int     16h             ;
 33637                                          test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 33638                                          jz      short kbd_notshift ; no
 33639                                          inc     bx              ; yes
 33640                                          inc     bx
 33641                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4301h
 33642                                  	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4
 33643                                  kbd_notshift:                   ;
 33644                                          mov     ah,1            ; peek the keyboard
 33645                                          int     16h             ;
 33646                                          jz	short kbd_test	; no key present
 33647                                          or      al,al           ; is it a function key?
 33648                                          jnz	short kbd_test	; no
 33649                                  
 33650                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:430Bh
 33651                                          cmp     ah,62h          ; CTRL F5
 33652                                          je	short kbd_cfg_bypass
 33653                                  	
 33654                                          cmp     ah,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 33655                                          jne	short kbd_notf5	; no
 33656                                  kbd_cfg_bypass:
 33657                                          mov     dx,_$CleanMsg
 33658                                          call    print
 33659                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:431Bh
 33660                                  	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4           ;
 33661                                          jmp     short kbd_eat   ; yes, clean boot selected
 33662                                  kbd_notf5:
 33663                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4322h
 33664                                          cmp     ah,65h          ; CTRL F8
 33665                                          je	short kbd_cfg_confirm
 33666                                  
 33667                                          cmp     ah,42h          ; F8 function key?
 33668                                          jne	short kbd_exit	; no
 33669                                  kbd_cfg_confirm:
 33670                                          mov     dx,_$InterMsg
 33671                                          call    print           ;
 33672                                          mov     bl,1            ; yes, interactive-boot option enabled
 33673                                          mov     [bQueryOpt],bl  ; change default setting
 33674                                  kbd_eat:                        ;
 33675                                          mov     ah,0            ;
 33676                                          int     16h             ; eat the key we assumed was a signal
 33677                                          mov	byte [secElapsed],-1
 33678                                          or      bx,bx           ;
 33679                                          jz	short kbd_clean	;
 33680                                  kbd_test:                       ;
 33681                                          cmp     bl,2            ;
 33682                                          jb	short kbd_exit	;
 33683                                  kbd_clean:                      ;
 33684                                          call    disable_autoexec; yes, tell COMMAND to skip autoexec.bat
 33685                                          stc                     ; set carry to indicate abort
 33686                                          retn			;
 33687                                  kbd_exit:                       ;
 33688                                          clc                     ; clear carry to indicate success
 33689                                          retn			;
 33690                                  
 33691                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33692                                  ;
 33693                                  ;   set_numlock: set numlock LED
 33694                                  ;
 33695                                  ;   INPUT
 33696                                  ;       ES:SI -> numlock setting (ie, "ON" or "OFF")
 33697                                  ;
 33698                                  ;   OUTPUT
 33699                                  ;       None
 33700                                  ;
 33701                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 33702                                  ;       None
 33703                                  ;
 33704                                  ;   HISTORY
 33705                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 33706                                  ;
 33707                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33708                                  
 33709                                  set_numlock:
 33710                                          push    ax
 33711                                          push    ds
 33712                                          sub     ax,ax
 33713                                          mov     ds,ax
 33714                                          mov     ax,[es:si]      ; get 1st 2 bytes of value (ON or OF)
 33715                                          cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff+2]	; should we turn it off?
 33716                                          jne	short not_off	; no
 33717                                          and     byte [0417h],~20h ; 0DFh
 33718                                          jmp     short set_done
 33719                                  not_off:
 33720                                          cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff]	; should we turn it on?
 33721                                          stc
 33722                                          jne	short set_done	; no
 33723                                          or      byte [0417h],20h
 33724                                  set_done:
 33725                                          pop     ds
 33726                                          pop     ax
 33727                                          retn
 33728                                  
 33729                                  ; 16/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33730                                  
 33731                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33732                                  ;
 33733                                  ;   menu_check:  check for presence of menu (and other) configuration blocks
 33734                                  ;
 33735                                  ;   INPUT
 33736                                  ;       CX == "organized" config.sys memory image length
 33737                                  ;    ES:SI -> "organized" config.sys memory image
 33738                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 33739                                  ;
 33740                                  ;   OUTPUT
 33741                                  ;       Same as above;  the idea is that menu_check simply transforms
 33742                                  ;       a block-structured config.sys image into a conventional image,
 33743                                  ;       based on the user's block selection and any other boot-time options
 33744                                  ;       the user may have employed...
 33745                                  ;
 33746                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 33747                                  ;       All
 33748                                  ;
 33749                                  ;   NOTES
 33750                                  ;       [count] and [org_count] are set to the new config.sys image length
 33751                                  ;
 33752                                  ;   HISTORY
 33753                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 33754                                  ;
 33755                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33756                                  
 33757                                  menu_check:
 33758                                  
 33759                                  ;   Search for SWITCHES, determine if /N or /F are present;  if so, then
 33760                                  ;   disable clean/interactive boot options
 33761                                  
 33762                                          push    cx              ;
 33763                                          push    si              ;
 33764                                          sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 33765                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 33766                                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 33767                                          jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 33768                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ;
 33769                                          jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 33770                                          inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 33771                                          jmp     short swchk_nextline
 33772                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 33773                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 33774                                          jne	short swchk_next2 ;
 33775                                          or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 33776                                          jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 33777                                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 33778                                          mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 33779                                          jmp     short swchk_nextline
 33780                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 33781                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 33782                                          jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 33783                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 33784                                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 33785                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 33786                                          cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 33787                                          je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 33788                                          cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 33789                                          jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 33790                                          call    get_char        ;
 33791                                          and     al,~20h ; 0DFh	; convert to upper case
 33792                                          cmp     al,[swit_n+1]
 33793                                          jne	short swchk_scan2 ; no
 33794                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 33795                                          jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 33796                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;
 33797                                          cmp     al,[swit_f+1]
 33798                                          jne	short swchk_scan1 ; no
 33799                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],2
 33800                                          jmp     short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 33801                                  swchk_nextline:                 ;
 33802                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 33803                                          jmp     short swchk_loop ;
 33804                                  swchk_end:                      ;
 33805                                          pop     si              ;
 33806                                          pop     cx              ;
 33807                                  
 33808                                  ;   Do the keyboard tests for clean/interactive boot now, but only if
 33809                                  ;   the DisableUI flag is still clear
 33810                                  
 33811                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 33812                                          jnz	short menu_search
 33813                                  ;
 33814                                  ;   Wait for 2 seconds first, UNLESS the /F bit was set in bDisableUI, or
 33815                                  ;   there is anything at all in the keyboard buffer
 33816                                  ;
 33817                                          call    kbd_read
 33818                                          jnc	short menu_search
 33819                                          jmp	menu_abort
 33820                                  
 33821                                  ;   Search for MENU block;  it is allowed to be anywhere in config.sys
 33822                                  
 33823                                  menu_search:
 33824                                          sub     bx,bx           ; if no MENU, default to zero for no_selection
 33825                                          mov     di,szMenu	;
 33826                                          call    find_block      ; find the MENU block
 33827                                          jnc	short menu_found ;
 33828                                          mov     byte [szBoot],0
 33829                                          jmp	no_selection ; not found
 33830                                  
 33831                                  ;   Process the requested menu color(s)
 33832                                  
 33833                                  menu_color:
 33834                                          push    cx              ;
 33835                                          push    dx              ;
 33836                                          mov     dx,0007h        ; default color setting
 33837                                          call    get_number	; get first number
 33838                                          and     bl,0Fh		; first # is foreground color (for low nibble)
 33839                                          mov     ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 33840                                          and     dl,0F0h         ;
 33841                                          or      dl,bl           ;
 33842                                          call    delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 33843                                          jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 33844                                          call    get_number	; get next number
 33845                                          and     bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 33846                                          mov     dh,bl           ; save it in DH
 33847                                          and     dl,0Fh		;
 33848                                          mov     cl,4            ;
 33849                                          shl     bl,cl           ;
 33850                                          or      dl,bl           ;
 33851                                  check_color:                    ;
 33852                                          cmp     ch,dh           ; are foreground/background the same?
 33853                                          jne	short set_color	; no
 33854                                          xor     dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 33855                                  set_color:
 33856                                          mov     [bMenuColor],dl ;
 33857                                          pop     dx              ;
 33858                                          pop     cx              ;
 33859                                          jmp	menu_nextitem
 33860                                  
 33861                                  ;   Back to our regularly scheduled program (the COLOR and other goop
 33862                                  ;   above is there simply to alleviate short jump problems)
 33863                                  
 33864                                  menu_found:
 33865                                          mov     byte [bDefBlock],1
 33866                                          mov     word [offDefBlock],0
 33867                                          mov     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 33868                                          and     byte [bQueryOpt],~2 ; 0FDh
 33869                                  
 33870                                          call    skip_opt_line   ; skip to next line
 33871                                          sub     dx,dx           ; initialize total block count (0 => none yet)
 33872                                  
 33873                                  ;   Process the menu block now
 33874                                  
 33875                                  menu_process:
 33876                                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 33877                                          jc	short to_menu_getdefault ; could happen if menu block at end (rare)
 33878                                          and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 33879                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; BEGIN implies END
 33880                                          je	short to_menu_getdefault
 33881                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_SUBMENU
 33882                                          je	short menu_item	; go process sub-menu
 33883                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUITEM
 33884                                          je	short menu_item	; go process menu item
 33885                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUDEFAULT
 33886                                          je	short menu_default ; go process menu default
 33887                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUCOLOR
 33888                                          je	short menu_color ; go process menu color
 33889                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 33890                                          je	short menu_numlock ;
 33891                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_REM   ; allow remarks in menu block
 33892                                          je	short menu_nextitem ;
 33893                                          call    any_delim       ; allow blank lines and such
 33894                                          je	short menu_nextitem ;
 33895                                          stc                     ;
 33896                                          call    print_error     ; non-MENU command!
 33897                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 33898                                  menu_numlock:
 33899                                          call    set_numlock
 33900                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 33901                                  to_menu_getdefault:
 33902                                          jmp     short menu_getdefault
 33903                                  
 33904                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 33905                                  
 33906                                  menu_default:
 33907                                          mov     [offDefBlock],si; save address of default block name
 33908                                          cmp     byte [secElapsed],0
 33909                                          jne	short timeout_skip ; secElapsed is only zero for the FIRST menu,
 33910                                          call    skip_token      ; and for subsequent menus IF nothing was typed;
 33911                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; secElapsed becomes -1 forever as soon as
 33912                                          call    skip_delim      ; something is typed
 33913                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ;
 33914                                          mov     si,bx           ;
 33915                                          call    get_number      ; get number (of seconds for timeout)
 33916                                          cmp     bl,90           ; limit it to a reasonable number
 33917                                          jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 33918                                          mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)
 33919                                  timeout_ok:                     ;
 33920                                          mov     [secTimeOut],bl ;
 33921                                  timeout_skip:
 33922                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 33923                                  
 33924                                  ;   Verify that this is a valid menu item by searching for the named block
 33925                                  
 33926                                  menu_item:
 33927                                          cmp     dl,MAX_MULTI_CONFIG ; have we reached the max # of items yet?
 33928                                          jae	short menu_nextitem ;
 33929                                          mov     di,si           ; DS:DI -> block name to search for
 33930                                          call    srch_block      ;
 33931                                          je	short menu_itemfound ;
 33932                                          stc                     ;
 33933                                          call    print_error     ; print error and pause
 33934                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem ; if not found, ignore this menu item
 33935                                  
 33936                                  ;   srch_block, having succeeded, returns DI -> past the token that it
 33937                                  ;   just matched, which in this case should be a descriptive string; ES:SI
 33938                                  ;   and CX are unmodified
 33939                                  
 33940                                  menu_itemfound:
 33941                                          inc     dx              ; otherwise, increment total block count
 33942                                          mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets
 33943                                          mov	[abBlockType+bx],al
 33944                                          add     bx,bx           ; of recorded block names and descriptions
 33945                                  
 33946                                  ;   There should be a description immediately following the block name on
 33947                                  ;   MENUITEM line; failing that, we'll just use the block name as the
 33948                                  ;   description...
 33949                                  
 33950                                          mov     [aoffBlockName+bx],si
 33951                                          mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],si
 33952                                          mov     di,bx           ; skip_delim modifies BX, so stash it in DI
 33953                                          call    skip_token      ;
 33954                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 33955                                          call    skip_delim      ;
 33956                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 33957                                          xchg    bx,di           ;
 33958                                          mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],di
 33959                                  
 33960                                  menu_nextitem:
 33961                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 33962                                          jmp     menu_process    ; go back for more lines
 33963                                  
 33964                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 33965                                  
 33966                                  menu_getdefault:
 33967                                          or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 33968                                          jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 33969                                          sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 33970                                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 33971                                  menu_valid:
 33972                                          sub     bx,bx           ;
 33973                                          mov     [bMaxBlock],dl  ; first, record how many blocks we found
 33974                                          mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 33975                                          or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 33976                                          jz	short menu_nodefault ; no
 33977                                          inc     bx              ; yes, walk name table, looking for default
 33978                                  menu_chkdefault:
 33979                                          push    bx              ;
 33980                                          add     bx,bx           ;
 33981                                          mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 33982                                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 33983                                          push    ds              ;
 33984                                          push    es              ;
 33985                                          pop     ds              ;
 33986                                          call    comp_names      ; is this block the same as the default?
 33987                                          pop     ds              ;
 33988                                          pop     bx              ;
 33989                                          je	short menu_setdefault ; yes
 33990                                          inc     bx              ;
 33991                                          cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done searching?
 33992                                          jbe	short menu_chkdefault ; not yet
 33993                                  menu_nodefault:
 33994                                          mov     bl,1            ; if no default, force default to #1
 33995                                  menu_setdefault:
 33996                                          mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 33997                                  
 33998                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 33999                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 34000                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 34001                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 34002                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 34003                                  ;   with no timeout)
 34004                                  
 34005                                          cmp     byte [secTimeOut],0 ; is timeout zero? (ie, assume default)
 34006                                          jne	short menu_display ; no
 34007                                          test    byte [bQueryOpt],1 ; yes, but was INTERACTIVE requested?
 34008                                          jnz	short menu_display ; yes, so *don't* assume default after all
 34009                                          jmp     not_topmenu	;
 34010                                  
 34011                                  ;   Reset the mode, so that we know screen is clean and cursor is home
 34012                                  
 34013                                  menu_display:
 34014                                          mov     ah,0Fh          ; get current video mode
 34015                                          int     10h             ;
 34016                                          mov     ah,00h          ; just re-select that mode
 34017                                          int     10h             ;
 34018                                          push    es              ;
 34019                                          mov     ax,40h          ; reach down into the ROM BIOS data area
 34020                                          mov     es,ax           ; and save the current (default) video page
 34021                                          mov     ax,[es:004Eh]   ; start address and page #, in case the
 34022                                          mov     [wCRTStart],ax  ; undocumented QUIET option was enabled
 34023                                          mov     al,[es:0062h]   ;
 34024                                          mov     [bCRTPage],al   ;
 34025                                          mov     ax,[bMenuPage]	; select new page for menu
 34026                                          int     10h             ;
 34027                                          mov     ax,0600h        ; clear entire screen
 34028                                          mov     bh,[bMenuColor] ; using this color
 34029                                          sub     cx,cx           ; upper left row/col
 34030                                          ;mov	dl,[es:CRT_Cols] 
 34031                                          mov	dl,[es:4Ah]
 34032                                  	dec     dl              ;
 34033                                          ;mov	dh,[es:CRT_Rows];
 34034                                          mov	dh,[es:84h]
 34035                                  	or      dh,dh           ; # of rows valid?
 34036                                          jnz	short menu_clear ; hopefully
 34037                                          mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; no, use a default
 34038                                  menu_clear:
 34039                                          int     10h             ; clear the screen using the req. attribute
 34040                                          pop     es              ;
 34041                                          mov     [bLastRow],dh   ; save DH
 34042                                          mov     dx,_$MenuHeader
 34043                                          call    print           ; cursor now on row 3 (numbered from 0)
 34044                                  
 34045                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 34046                                          jnz     short menu_nostatus
 34047                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 34048                                          mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; restore DH
 34049                                          mov     dl,0            ; print the status line on row DH, col 0,
 34050                                          mov     ah,02h          ; now that we can trash the cursor position
 34051                                          int     10h             ;
 34052                                          mov     dx,_$StatusLine
 34053                                          call    print           ;
 34054                                          mov     ah,3            ; get cursor position
 34055                                          int     10h             ;
 34056                                          sub     dl,2            ;
 34057                                          mov     [bLastCol],dl   ; save column where status char will go
 34058                                  
 34059                                  menu_nostatus:
 34060                                          mov     bx,1            ; now prepare to display all the menu items
 34061                                  menu_disploop:
 34062                                          call    print_item	; print item #BL
 34063                                          inc     bx              ; why "inc bx"?  because it's a 1-byte opcode
 34064                                          cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done?
 34065                                          jbe	short menu_disploop ; not yet
 34066                                  
 34067                                  ;   Set cursor position to just below the menu items
 34068                                  
 34069                                          mov     dl,0            ; select column
 34070                                          mov     dh,bl           ;
 34071                                          add     dh,4            ; select row below menu
 34072                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 34073                                          mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position beneath the block list
 34074                                          int     10h             ;
 34075                                  
 34076                                          mov     dx,_$MenuPrmpt
 34077                                          call    print           ;
 34078                                          call    select_item     ; make a selection, return # in BX
 34079                                          mov     dx,crlfm	
 34080                                          call    print           ;
 34081                                          push    word [bDisableUI]
 34082                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 34083                                          call    show_status     ; clear the status line now
 34084                                          pop     word [bDisableUI]
 34085                                  
 34086                                  ;   Now begins the "re-organization" process...
 34087                                  
 34088                                  menu_autoselect:
 34089                                          cmp     bx,-1           ; clean boot requested?
 34090                                          jne	short normal_boot ; no
 34091                                          call    disable_autoexec; basically, add a /D to the command.com line
 34092                                  menu_abort:
 34093                                          sub     cx,cx           ; then immediately exit with 0 config.sys image
 34094                                          jmp	menu_exit	;
 34095                                  
 34096                                  normal_boot:
 34097                                          cmp     bx,-2           ; back to top-level menu?
 34098                                          jne	short not_topmenu ; no
 34099                                          mov     cx,[count]      ; yes, start all over
 34100                                          sub     si,si           ;
 34101                                          jmp     menu_search
 34102                                  
 34103                                  not_topmenu:
 34104                                          cmp     byte [abBlockType+bx],CONFIG_SUBMENU
 34105                                          jne	short not_submenu
 34106                                          add     bx,bx           ;
 34107                                          mov     di,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 34108                                          call    srch_block      ; THIS CANNOT FAIL!
 34109                                          mov     si,di           ;
 34110                                          mov     cx,bx           ; ES:SI and CX are ready for another round
 34111                                          jmp     menu_found
 34112                                  
 34113                                  not_submenu:
 34114                                          add     bx,bx           ; get BX -> name of selected block
 34115                                          mov     bx,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 34116                                  
 34117                                  ;   BX should now either be ZERO (meaning no block has been selected) or
 34118                                  ;   the offset relative to ES of the block name to be processed (along with
 34119                                  ;   all the "common" lines of course)
 34120                                  
 34121                                  no_selection:
 34122                                          mov     [offDefBlock],bx; save selection
 34123                                          mov     cx,[count]      ; reset ES:SI and CX for reprocessing
 34124                                          sub     si,si           ;
 34125                                          push    ds              ;
 34126                                          mov     ds,[config_wrkseg]; this is where we'll store new config.sys image
 34127                                          sub     di,di           ;
 34128                                  
 34129                                  ;   ES:SI-> config.sys, DS:DI -> new config.sys workspace
 34130                                  ;
 34131                                  ;   Work our way through the config.sys image again, this time copying
 34132                                  ;   all lines that are (A) "common" lines outside any block or (B) lines
 34133                                  ;   within the requested block.  Lines inside INCLUDEd blocks are transparently
 34134                                  ;   copied by copy_block in a recursive fashion;  the amount of recursion is
 34135                                  ;   limited by the fact INCLUDE statements are REMed by copy_block as they are
 34136                                  ;   processed and by the number of unique INCLUDE stmts in config.sys...
 34137                                  ;
 34138                                  ;   BUGBUG 20-Mar-1992 JeffPar: If we can figure out the lower bound of the
 34139                                  ;   stack we're running on, then we should check it inside copy_block
 34140                                  
 34141                                  copyblock_loop:
 34142                                          push    bx              ; save selected block name
 34143                                          call    copy_block      ; process (named or common) block
 34144                                          pop     bx              ;
 34145                                          jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 34146                                  
 34147                                  ;   copy_block can only return for two reasons:  it hit eof or a new block
 34148                                  
 34149                                  copyblock_begin:
 34150                                          push    ax              ;
 34151                                          push    cx              ;
 34152                                          push    si              ;
 34153                                          push    di              ; always do "common" blocks
 34154                                          mov     di,szCommon
 34155                                          push    ds              ;
 34156                                          push    cs              ;
 34157                                          pop     ds              ;
 34158                                          call    comp_names      ;
 34159                                          pop     ds              ;
 34160                                          pop     di              ;
 34161                                          pop     si              ;
 34162                                          pop     cx              ;
 34163                                          pop     ax              ;
 34164                                          je	short copyblock_check
 34165                                          or      bx,bx           ; is there a block name to check?
 34166                                          jz	short copyblock_skip ; no
 34167                                          push    di              ;
 34168                                          mov     di,bx           ; check block against given block name
 34169                                          push    ds              ;
 34170                                          push    es              ;
 34171                                          pop     ds              ;
 34172                                          call    comp_names      ; is this the block we really want to do?
 34173                                          pop     ds              ;
 34174                                          pop     di              ;
 34175                                  copyblock_check:
 34176                                          jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 34177                                          jne	short copyblock_skip  ;
 34178                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 34179                                          jmp	short copyblock_loop 
 34180                                  
 34181                                  copyblock_skip:                 ;
 34182                                          call    skip_opt_line   ; this ain't the block we wanted, so skip it
 34183                                          call    get_char        ;
 34184                                          jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 34185                                          and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 34186                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ;
 34187                                          je	short copyblock_begin
 34188                                          jmp     short copyblock_skip ; anything else is just skipped
 34189                                  ;
 34190                                  ;   To create as little risk to the rest of SysInit as little as possible,
 34191                                  ;   and to free the workspace at "config_wrkseg" for creating an environment,
 34192                                  ;   copy the new config.sys image to "confbot"
 34193                                  ;
 34194                                  move_config:
 34195                                          mov     cx,di           ; now copy workspace at DS:DI to "confbot"
 34196                                          push    cx              ;
 34197                                  ;
 34198                                  ;   But first, copy the CONFIG=<configuration><0> string to the workspace,
 34199                                  ;   since the configuration name only currently exists in the "confbot" area
 34200                                  ;
 34201                                   	;mov	cx,7
 34202                                  	mov     cx,szMenu-szBoot-1
 34203                                          mov     si,szBoot	; first copy the CONFIG= part
 34204                                          inc     di              ; skip a byte, in case absolutely nothing
 34205                                                                  ; was copied to the workspace, because we always
 34206                                                                  ; zero the first byte of the workspace (below)
 34207                                  copy_boot: 
 34208                                  	;lods    byte ptr cs:[si];
 34209                                          cs
 34210                                  	lodsb
 34211                                  	mov     [di],al         ;
 34212                                          inc     di              ;
 34213                                          loop    copy_boot       ;
 34214                                  
 34215                                          push    es              ; then copy the configuration name
 34216                                          mov     cx,128-7        ; put an upper limit on the name, to be safe
 34217                                          mov     si,[cs:offDefBlock]; ES:SI -> default block name
 34218                                          or      si,si           ; valid?
 34219                                          jnz	short l1	; yes
 34220                                          push    cs              ;
 34221                                          pop     es              ;
 34222                                          mov     si,szCommon
 34223                                  l1:     mov     al,[es:si]      ;
 34224                                          call    any_delim       ;
 34225                                          je	short l2	;
 34226                                          mov     [di],al         ;
 34227                                          inc     si              ;
 34228                                          inc     di              ;
 34229                                          loop    l1              ;
 34230                                  l2:     mov     byte [di],lf	; terminate the configuration string
 34231                                          pop     es              ;
 34232                                  
 34233                                  ;   Now we can copy "config_wrkseg" (DS) to "confbot" (ES)
 34234                                  
 34235                                          sub     di,di           ;
 34236                                          mov     [cs:config_envlen],di
 34237                                          sub     si,si           ;
 34238                                          pop     cx              ; recover the size of "config_wrkseg"
 34239                                  
 34240                                          push    cx              ;
 34241                                          rep     movsb           ; moved!
 34242                                          pop     cx              ;
 34243                                          mov     ax,ds           ;
 34244                                          pop     ds              ;
 34245                                  
 34246                                  ;   Now that the config_wrkseg is available once again, we shall
 34247                                  ;   use it to create an environment. The first thing to go in will be
 34248                                  ;   the "CONFIG=configuration" thing. It is also important to zero
 34249                                  ;   the first byte of the workspace, so that copy_envvar knows the buffer
 34250                                  ;   is empty.
 34251                                  
 34252                                          push    es              ;
 34253                                          mov     es,ax           ;
 34254                                          inc     si              ; ES:SI -> "CONFIG=configuration"
 34255                                          mov     byte [es:0],0	;empty the environment block
 34256                                          call    copy_envvar     ; copy envvar at ES:SI to "config_wrkseg"
 34257                                          pop     es
 34258                                  
 34259                                  ;   Before returning, restore the default video page setting but do NOT
 34260                                  ;   do it using INT 10h's Set Active Page function, because if the menu was
 34261                                  ;   displayed on a different page, then it's because we don't want to see
 34262                                  ;   all the device driver/TSR goop (which goes to the default page)
 34263                                  
 34264                                  menu_done:
 34265                                          cmp     byte [bMenuPage],0
 34266                                          je	short menu_exit	;
 34267                                          push    es              ;
 34268                                          mov     ax,40h          ;
 34269                                          mov     es,ax           ;
 34270                                          mov     ax,[wCRTStart]  ;
 34271                                          mov     [es:004Eh],ax   ;
 34272                                          mov     al,[bCRTPage]   ;
 34273                                          mov     [es:0062h],al   ;
 34274                                          pop     es              ;
 34275                                  menu_exit:
 34276                                          mov     [count],cx      ; set new counts
 34277                                          mov     [org_count],cx  ;
 34278                                          sub     si,si           ; always return ES:SI pointing to config.sys
 34279                                          retn
 34280                                  
 34281                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34282                                  ;
 34283                                  ;   copy_envvar:  copy the envvar at ES:SI to "config_wrkseg"
 34284                                  ;
 34285                                  ;   INPUT
 34286                                  ;    ES:SI -> environment variable (in the form "var=string<cr/lf>")
 34287                                  ;
 34288                                  ;   OUTPUT
 34289                                  ;       config_envlen (ie, where to put next envvar) updated appropriately
 34290                                  ;       carry set if error (eg, missing =); clear otherwise
 34291                                  ;
 34292                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 34293                                  ;       None
 34294                                  ;
 34295                                  ;   NOTES
 34296                                  ;       None
 34297                                  ;
 34298                                  ;   HISTORY
 34299                                  ;       Created 29-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 34300                                  ;
 34301                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34302                                  
 34303                                  copy_envvar:
 34304                                          push    cx              ;
 34305                                          push    si              ;
 34306                                          push    ds              ;
 34307                                          push    es              ;
 34308                                          push    es              ;
 34309                                          mov     es,[config_wrkseg] ; ES:DI to point to next available byte
 34310                                          pop     ds                 ; DS:SI to point to envvar
 34311                                  
 34312                                  ;   Have to calculate the length of the variable name (and if we hit
 34313                                  ;   the end of the line before we hit '=', then it's curtains for this
 34314                                  ;   config.sys line)
 34315                                  ;
 34316                                  ;   The check for NULL is important because copy_envvar is also used to copy
 34317                                  ;   the initial CONFIG= setting, which will have been zapped by a NULL if no
 34318                                  ;   menu block existed (in order to prevent the creation of an environment)
 34319                                  
 34320                                          sub     cx,cx           ;
 34321                                  copy_varlen:                    ;
 34322                                          lodsb                   ;
 34323                                          or      al,al           ; NULL?
 34324                                          stc                     ;
 34325                                          jz	short copy_envexit ; yes, abort
 34326                                          cmp     al,cr          ;
 34327                                          stc                     ;
 34328                                          je	short copy_envexit
 34329                                          cmp     al,lf          ;
 34330                                          stc                     ;
 34331                                          je	short copy_envexit
 34332                                          inc     cx              ;
 34333                                          cmp     al,'='          ;
 34334                                          jne	short copy_varlen
 34335                                          mov     al,0            ;
 34336                                          mov     ah,[si]         ; save char after '='
 34337                                          sub     si,cx           ; back up to given varname
 34338                                          dec     cx              ; CX == # of bytes in varname
 34339                                          sub     di,di           ; start looking for DS:SI at ES:0
 34340                                  copy_varsrch:
 34341                                          cmp     byte [es:di],al
 34342                                          je	short copy_envprep ; search failed, just copy var
 34343                                          mov     bx,di           ; ES:BX -> start of this varname
 34344                                          push    cx              ;
 34345                                          push    si              ;
 34346                                          repe    cmpsb           ;
 34347                                          pop     si              ;
 34348                                          pop     cx              ;
 34349                                          jne	short copy_varnext ; no match, skip to next varname
 34350                                          cmp     byte [es:di],'='
 34351                                          jne     short copy_varnext ; no match, there's more characters
 34352                                  
 34353                                  ;   Previous occurrence of variable has been found; determine the
 34354                                  ;   entire length and then destroy it
 34355                                  
 34356                                          mov     cx,-1           ;
 34357                                          repne   scasb           ; guaranteed to get null (since we put it there)
 34358                                          push    si              ;
 34359                                          mov     si,di           ;
 34360                                          mov     di,bx           ;
 34361                                          mov     cx,[cs:config_envlen]
 34362                                          sub     cx,si           ; destroy variable now
 34363                                  	;rep movs byte ptr es:[di],byte ptr es:[si]
 34364                                  	;;db 0F3h,26h,0A4h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO:SYS - SYSINIT:4724h
 34365                                  
 34366                                  	rep	; 0F3h
 34367                                  	es	; 26h
 34368                                  	movsb	; 0A4h
 34369                                  
 34370                                  	pop     si
 34371                                  copy_envprep:
 34372                                          cmp     ah,cr          ; if there is nothing after the '='
 34373                                          je	short copy_envdel ; then just exit with variable deleted
 34374                                          cmp     ah,lf           ;
 34375                                          je	short copy_envdel
 34376                                          jmp     short copy_envloop
 34377                                  
 34378                                  copy_varnext:                   ;
 34379                                          push    cx              ;
 34380                                          mov     cx,-1           ;
 34381                                          repne   scasb           ;
 34382                                          pop     cx              ;
 34383                                          jmp	short copy_varsrch
 34384                                  
 34385                                  copy_envloop:                   ;
 34386                                          lodsb                   ;
 34387                                          cmp     al,cr           ;
 34388                                          je	short copy_envdone
 34389                                          cmp     al,lf           ;
 34390                                          je	short copy_envdone
 34391                                          stosb                   ;
 34392                                          jmp     short copy_envloop
 34393                                  
 34394                                  copy_envdone:                   ;
 34395                                          sub     al,al           ; do SUB to clear carry as well
 34396                                          stosb                   ; always null-terminate these puppies
 34397                                  copy_envdel:                    ;
 34398                                          mov     [es:di],al      ; and stick another null to terminate the env.
 34399                                          mov     [cs:config_envlen],di
